0.title: Priyanka meets detained Congress leaders at Delhi police station
0.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Monday met with detained party leaders at Delhi's Tughlak Road police station. The Congress leaders were detained following their protests in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi, as he appeared before Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case. Congress shared pictures of the meeting on its Twitter handle.

1.title: I'm really excited: Fatima on playing Indira Gandhi in Sam Bahadur
1.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh has begun preparations for her upcoming film 'Sam Bahadur'. The actress will be seen playing the role of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the film. Speaking about it, Fatima said that she is very "excited". She added that she is studying thoroughly about Indira Gandhi by watching all her interviews and reading about her.

2.title: Our main aim is obviously the T20 WC in Australia: Shreyas Iyer
2.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has said the team's main aim is the upcoming T20 World Cup that will be played in Australia. "We have that sort of mindset where we're completely free and not thinking about anything else," he stated. "Even if we fail, we'll learn from that...and grow as a team...that's more important till we reach Australia," he added.

3.title: Bulldozer has become symbol of state-sponsored hooliganism: RLD chief
3.article_body: RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said the use of a bulldozer is not the enforcement of the rule of law rather, it has become a symbol of state-sponsored "hooliganism". His statement came on Sunday when Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed’s property was demolished by the UP government. Javed was arrested on Saturday for his role in protests over Prophet remarks.

4.title: 2 police personnel injured in communal clash in Gujarat's Anand, 21 booked
4.article_body: As many as 21 persons have been booked for rioting and injuring two police personnel after two communities clashed in Borsad city of Gujarat's Anand following an altercation. Anand SP said the incident took place when police were trying to disperse the crowd and a mob from one of the communities started pelting stones at them.

5.title: Berrettini beats ex-world no. 1 Murray to win 1st title of 2022 in Stuttgart
5.article_body: World number 10 Matteo Berrettini won his first title of the season on Sunday after defeating ex-world number one Andy Murray 6-4, 5-7, 6-3 at Boss Open, Stuttgart. The 26-year-old Italian missed the clay season after undergoing a minor operation on his right hand in late March. "It's unbelievable. It was obviously a goal [to win the title]," said Berrettini.

6.title: Proud of my team: WI skipper Pooran after losing ODI series to Pak
6.article_body: Despite losing the ODI series to Pakistan by 3-0, West Indies limited-overs captain Nicholas Pooran has said that he is proud of his team. "We didn't get the results...but I am so proud of this team for sticking together through difficult periods and putting everything on the line for the people of the West Indies," Pooran said.

7.title: Assam Police nab 2 youths planning to join Naga separatist group
7.article_body: Assam Police apprehended two persons from the state's Sadiya district who were planning on joining Naga separatist outfit, NSCN-IM. The police, which received intelligence inputs, nabbed the youths and counselled them before handing them over to their respective families. "Youth can easily be influenced through social media. We are monitoring all activities," a police official said.

8.title: 'Drunk' bus driver loses control, vehicle overturns in Andhra; 5 dead
8.article_body: Five people, including a two-year-old baby, were killed and seven others were injured after a bus overturned in Andhra Pradesh's Sri Alluri Sitharamaraju district on Monday, police said. The accident occurred when the driver lost control of the bus while negotiating a turn. The bus passengers alleged that the driver was drunk and was driving in a rash manner.

9.title: 250 Cong workers detained in Mumbai for protesting in Rahul's support
9.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Monday detained over 250 Congress workers who took out a protest march in support of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi who was summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The workers marched from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus to the ED office. Rahul appeared before the ED in connection with the National Herald case.

10.title: Macron's alliance edges ahead in 1st round of French elections
10.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron's alliance won the first round of parliamentary elections held on Sunday by a slim margin. While Macron's Ensemble alliance bagged 25.75% of the total votes, the rival bloc of NUPES led by Jean-Luc Melenchon secured 25.66%. The second and final round of elections will be held on June 19.

11.title: Video of Siddhanth from rave party surfaces after he gets detained for consuming drugs
11.article_body: A video of actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor from rave party in a Bengaluru hotel has surfaced online after he was detained for consuming drugs. In the video, Siddhanth can be seen DJing at the venue. Another leaked clip showed police officials talking to the people after conducting a raid at the party.

12.title: Chhavi shares pic of scars from breast cancer surgery, says 'Will never remove them'
12.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of her scars from breast cancer surgery. "Yesterday when I found the courage to flaunt this scar...there were some who flinched at the sight of it," she wrote. She added, "Some have also asked me if I’ll remove these scars with a laser or some such and I say never!"

13.title: We still haven't realised we're married: Ranbir on life with Alia after marriage
13.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor in an interview opened up about his life after marriage with Alia Bhatt and said that there have been no major changes in their lives. "The very next day of...marriage, we...left for work...We still haven't realised...we're married," he added. Ranbir further said they are thinking of taking a week off after the release of his film 'Shamshera'.

14.title: Bulldozers missing: Karti Chidambaram as Rahul appears before ED
14.article_body: Congress' Karti Chidambaram on Monday said he was "surprised" that BJP has only placed barricades and police leading to Congress office in Delhi, bulldozers were missing. "Guess all have been requisitioned to demolish lives and houses of citizens belonging to the minority faith," Chidambaram added. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before ED today after protest march.

15.title: Hyd man stuffs expired chemicals in manhole, dies as it explodes
15.article_body: A man in Hyderabad died after there was a blast in the sewerage manhole in which he dumped expired chemicals over time. Reports said that the man saw that the chemicals had not settled in the manhole. He then poured water on the chemicals, leading to a blast. His father was also injured in the incident.

16.title: Google engineer claims AI chatbot is 'behaving like a human', put on leave
16.article_body: A Google engineer, who claimed that a company's artificial intelligence-based chatbot had become "sentient" and was thinking and reasoning like a human being, has been placed on a paid leave. Google has also dismissed his claims. Blake Lemoine had published transcripts of his conversation with the LaMDA (Language Model for Dialogue Applications) chatbot and described it as "a person".

17.title: Sensex ends over 1,400 points lower, Nifty below 15,800 amid global selloff
17.article_body: The Sensex crashed 1,456 points to settle at 52,846 on Monday, whereas the Nifty closed 427 points lower at 15,774 amid global selloff. Bajaj twins, Tech Mahindra, IndusInd Bank and ICICI Bank were the top losers among S&P BSE Sensex companies, while Nestle India was the only gainer. The decline comes ahead of India's CPI inflation data on Monday evening.

18.title: Former British soldier killed fighting Russian forces in Ukraine
18.article_body: A former British soldier, Jordan Gatley, has been killed fighting for the Ukrainian armed forces in the city of Sievierodonetsk. Gatley had left the British Army in March and went to Ukraine to help in the fight against the Russian forces. Gatley's family said it had received the news on Friday that he had been shot and killed.

19.title: Bhuvneshwar knows selectors aren't considering him for Tests: Jaffer
19.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised Bhuvneshwar Kumar for his performance against South Africa in the second T20I on Sunday. "Bhuvneshwar is doing what he's famous for, making the ball swing...He knows selectors aren't considering him for Tests and he's playing just white-ball cricket," added Jaffer. Bhuvneshwar picked four wickets, conceding 13 runs in the game.

20.title: Ruturaj Gaikwad should be given one more opportunity: Sanjay Bangar
20.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar said Ruturaj Gaikwad should be given one more opportunity in the T20I series against South Africa. "The Indian team has...expectations from Ruturaj, they see him as a future top-order batter...his performance will...come under the microscope," he added. Sanjay said Ravi Bishnoi and Arshdeep Singh can replace Axar Patel and Avesh Khan in the third T20I.

21.title: Rahul leaves ED office after appearing in National Herald case
21.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left the ED's office on June 13 after appearing in the National Herald money laundering case. Delhi Police detained several party leaders on Monday for staging protests against the Centre. Among those detained include Ashok Gehlot, Deepender Singh Hooda, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, KC Venugopal, Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh, Rajni Patil and Akhilesh Prasad Singh.

22.title: Most accidents resulting in deaths happen between 6pm & 9pm: Pune police
22.article_body: Most accidents in Pune in which deaths were reported happened between 6 pm and 9 pm, as per a study conducted by the Pune traffic branch. It added that the accidents in which serious injuries were reported happened between 9 am and 12 pm. The study was carried out from January to December 2021.

23.title: 'Major' actor Adivi meets Maha CM, calls it 'incredible moment'
23.article_body: Adivi Sesh, who was most recently seen in 'Major', met Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and described it as an incredible moment. Adivi, who has announced a fund in the name of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, wrote, "He (Uddhav Thackeray) promised to extend full support for our MAJOR promise fund for NDA aspirants." Adivi also thanked Mahesh Manjrekar for facilitating the meeting.

24.title: John Cena meets teen fan with Down Syndrome who fled Ukraine
24.article_body: Wrestler-actor John Cena recently flew down to meet a 19-year-old fan named Misha with Down Syndrome who fled Ukraine after his home was destroyed. Misha's mom motivated him to travel across Europe by telling him that they were going to meet Cena. In a video shared by WWE, Cena said, "Misha's story...reached out to me...story of Misha's mom as well."

25.title: Too much: Venkatesh Prasad on Nupur Sharma's effigy hanging outside mosque
25.article_body: Former cricketer Venkatesh Prasad has expressed concern over the hanging of suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's effigy outside a mosque in Karnataka amid protests against her comments on Prophet Muhammad. "I would urge everyone to leave politics aside and let sanity prevail. This is just too much," he tweeted. "Two wrongs don't make a right," Prasad further said.

26.title: I've no dreams like Alia to star in a H'wood film; I'm happy where I am: Ranbir
26.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor spoke about his plans of starring in a Hollywood film. He revealed he has no dreams of Hollywood. "I only have dreams of Brahmastra. I think original content that is in your culture...can touch every audience," he said. "I've never seen the success and dreams of Alia (wife) in anyone else. I'm happy where I'm," he added.

27.title: K'taka Guv, CM receive President Kovind on his arrival in B'luru
27.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has arrived in Karnataka's Bengaluru for his two-day visit. He was received by the state Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot and CM Basavaraj Bommai on his arrival. The President will be attending the Platinum Jubilee Celebrations of Rashtriya Military School today, while tomorrow he will attend the Lokarpana ceremony of ISKCON's Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple.

28.title: West Bengal extends summer vacations till June 26 due to ‘extreme heatwave’
28.article_body: The West Bengal government has extended the summer vacations in the state till June 26. "With regard to declaring summer vacations in the schools due to extreme heatwave conditions, as reports of a few death cases due to heat and humidity have been received, the competent authority has decided to extend the summer vacations," the government release said.

29.title: Selectively highlighting arrest of individual: Luv on Siddhanth's arrest
29.article_body: Shatrughan Sinha's son Luv Sinha has reacted to the arrest of Shakti Kapoor's son Siddhanth Kapoor for consuming drugs. He tweeted, "Selectively highlighting the arrest...seems like an effort to show that [officials] are doing their job instead of actually doing it." Luv added, "Arrest the producers...not just the users...I hope my friend [Siddhanth] comes out of this stronger and wiser."

30.title: Man dies in police custody, 2nd custodial death in Chennai in 2 months
30.article_body: A history-sheeter died allegedly in police custody in Chennai on Sunday. This was the second such instance in Chennai in two months. Notably, the deceased, identified as Rajasekar, was taken into custody in connection with an investigation. Later, he was taken to a private hospital after he complained of feeling unwell, where he was declared brought dead, police said.

31.title: Driver rapes married woman in his bus in Pune, arrested
31.article_body: A 38-year-old driver of a private tourist bus has been arrested for allegedly raping a 21-year-old woman in his vehicle in Pune, police said. The victim, who is from Maharashtra's Washim district, came to Pune along with her husband a few days ago in search of a job. The couple worked as labourers, the police added.

32.title: Loan recovery agents threaten to invite Mumbai man's contacts to his funeral
32.article_body: A 37-year old man from Mumbai has claimed that loan recovery agents allegedly threatened to call each person in his contact list and invite them to his funeral if he didn't repay them. The agents allegedly said they would tell the man's contacts that he had passed away. The accused also allegedly shared with the victim his obscene morphed image.

33.title: India lose 2-3 to Belgium at FIH Men's Pro Hockey League
33.article_body: India lost to Belgium 2-3 in the second leg of their FIH Men's Pro Hockey League tie in Antwerp, Belgium, on Sunday. Following the loss, India dropped down to third from second in the standings, with 29 points from 14 matches. India will now play against table-toppers Netherlands on June 18 and 19 in Rotterdam.

34.title: Mobile point-of-sale app QueueBuster raises ₹63 cr in Series A round
34.article_body: Noida-based mobile point-of-sale application QueueBuster on Monday raised ₹63.3 crore in a Series A funding round led by Chiratae Ventures, Omidyar Network India and Flourish Ventures. The application can be used to manage billing, inventory, customers and loyalty programmes for all forms of businesses. The startup was founded in 2016 by a team of second-time entrepreneurs led by Varun Tangri.

35.title: No one better to do it: Chris on Mackie becoming Captain America
35.article_body: Actor Chris Evans said he's proud of actor Anthony Mackie for becoming the new Captain America in the MCU. "No one better to do it....he honestly does it justice," Chris stated. "I can't wait to see what they do in the future with it, but if there's any tear shed, it's just for the sweet memories I had," he added.

36.title: Chiranjeevi voices Brahmastra's Telugu trailer; Ayan touches his feet
36.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi will also be a part of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer Brahmastra. The veteran Telugu actor came on board to lend his voice for the Telugu version of director Ayan Mukerji's Brahmastra trailer. In a behind-the-scenes video shared by Ayan, Chiranjeevi is seen recording his portion for the trailer, meanwhile, Ayan welcomed the actor by touching his feet.

37.title: Inclination might be towards Umran for the next match vs SA: Zaheer
37.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan has said Team India might include pacer Umran Malik in the playing XI for their next match against South Africa in the ongoing T20I series. "Extra pace can be handy...I'm expecting...one change purely because the ground [for the third T20I] is small," he added. Umran is yet to make his debut for Team India.

38.title: Will take U'khand forward: CM after taking oath as Champawat MLA
38.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who took oath as Champawat's MLA on Monday, thanked PM Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders for giving "the son of a soldier" the opportunity to lead the state. Dhami added that he'll work towards Uttarakhand's progress and make it one of India's best states. He won by over 55,000 votes in state Assembly bypolls.

39.title: Munawar Faruqui refers to Bieber's facial paralysis in his political joke, criticised
39.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has been criticised after he referred to Justin Bieber's facial paralysis in a political joke. "Dear Justin Bieber, I can totally understand. Even here in India right side [is] not working properly," Faruqui wrote. "You think making a joke about somebody’s illness is funny?" a comment read. "Don’t use someone else’s pain...in...name of comedy," another user wrote.

40.title: 'Abnormal' dinosaur egg fossil discovered in MP, pics released
40.article_body: Delhi University researchers have found an unusual fossilised egg of a titanosaurid dinosaur in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, pictures of which have been released in the Scientific Reports journal. This is the first time scientists have come across the "abnormal" and rare 'egg-within-an-egg' or 'ovum-in-ovo' phenomenon in dinosaurs. It's been known to occur only in birds until now.

41.title: Ramped up medical supplies amid COVID-19, WTO couldn't respond with alacrity: India
41.article_body: India ramped up its supplies of medical products to different countries to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic, but the World Trade Organisation (WTO) could not react with alacrity, said Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. He added, "The rich countries need to introspect. We need to bow our heads in shame for our inability to respond to the pandemic in time."

42.title: Will build counter-strike capabilities: Japan PM after admitting issues with China
42.article_body: Speaking at the Shangri-La Dialogue, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said, "I am determined to fundamentally reinforce Japan's defence capabilities...In doing so we will not rule out any options, including the so-called counter-strike capabilities." PM Kishida admitted that issues exist between Japan and China due to being neighbouring countries and called on China to "act responsibly".

43.title: India should persist with Ishan even when Rohit, Rahul return: Gambhir
43.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Team India should persist with opener Ishan Kishan in the playing XI even when Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli return to the team. "Whether Ishan scores runs or not, he brings in that fearless approach," stated Gambhir. Ishan has scored 76 and 34 runs in the two T20Is against South Africa.

44.title: UP govt creating an atmosphere of terror by bulldozing homes: Mayawati
44.article_body: BSP President Mayawati has criticised the Uttar Pradesh Government for demolishing the homes of protestors, especially from the Muslim community, using bulldozers. "By targeting a particular community, by bulldozing their homes...the state government is suppressing the citizen's right to protest and creating an atmosphere of fear and terror, which is unfair and unjust," Mayawati tweeted.

45.title: VHP passes resolution for implementation of Uniform Civil Code
45.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Sunday passed a resolution calling for the implementation of a Uniform Civil Code in the country. "For the resolution of various problems in the country, it is imperative to implement one law for every section of the society," said religious leader Swami Avdheshanand Giri Maharaj at the meeting held in Haridwar.

46.title: Extended ITO skywalk to connect Delhi's Pragati Maidan metro station & SC
46.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) is planning to add an arm to the existing ITO skywalk by constructing a foot-overbridge to provide direct connectivity between the Supreme Court and Pragati Maidan metro station. The department has floated tenders for the overbridge's construction at an estimated cost of ₹9.3 crore. The tendering process will be completed by this month-end, officials said.

47.title: 4 policemen host booze party at traffic police outpost in Guj; held
47.article_body: Four police officers, including an assistant sub-inspector, were arrested on Sunday for hosting a booze party at a traffic police outpost in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The accused police officers were arrested after they were allegedly found in an inebriated state, as per the police. A police team had raided the outpost after a video of the party surfaced online.

48.title: Dad being framed, he's been cooperative: UP violence accused's daughter
48.article_body: Sumaiya Fatima, daughter of Javed Mohammad, who is an accused in the violence that erupted in Uttar Pradesh following remarks made about Prophet by a former BJP leader, said that her father is being framed. "He has always been cooperative with the administration and has never been named in anything illegal," Fatima added

49.title: Director convinced my dad overnight: Shilpa on her 1st film offer
49.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty revealed director Dilip Naik had offered a film to her when she was 17 while she had gone for a screen test for an ad. Shilpa added she told Dilip that her father will not allow her to act. "He visited our house...convinced my dad overnight that I was a perfect fit for his film," she stated.

50.title: Akshay used to wake up at 4:30, 7 am shift was cakewalk for him: Co-star Deepak
50.article_body: Deepak Tijori, while recalling working with Akshay Kumar in the film 'Khiladi', said that Akshay used to wake up at 4:30 am. "For him, 7:00 am shift was a cakewalk...Meanwhile, I'd to die a million deaths to reach the sets at 7:00 am," he added. Deepak further said Akshay was very disciplined as he was into fitness and martial arts.

51.title: Investors lose ₹7 lakh crore wealth as Sensex crashes over 1,600 points
51.article_body: Nearly ₹7 lakh crore was wiped out of the investors' wealth on Monday as the Sensex crashed more than 1,600 points in afternoon trade. Indian shares fell sharply amid a global selloff in the equities market. The selloff was triggered after US inflation hit a 40-year-high of 8.6% in May. Indian rupee hit record low of 78 per US dollar.

52.title: Rekha in talks to join Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Report
52.article_body: Veteran actress Rekha is reportedly in advanced talks with Sanjay Leela Bhansali for a pivotal role in his web series 'Heeramandi'. "Rekha has been keen to work with Bhansali for the longest time and he too is desirous of tapping into 'the Rekha mystique'," a source told Bollywood Hungama. 'Heeramandi' will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore.

53.title: If he plays big knock, Ruturaj can be in India's T20 WC squad: Jaffer
53.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said opener Ruturaj Gaikwad played an "attractive" knock in Delhi in the first T20I against South Africa. "I see him getting opportunities in the future...because there's no third opener in this team. No replacement has been made [for KL Rahul]," he added. "If he plays...big innings, he can...be a candidate [for India's T20 World Cup squad]," he stated.

54.title: Shane Warne recognised posthumously in Queen's birthday honours
54.article_body: Shane Warne has been recognised posthumously in this year's Queen’s birthday honours list. He was honoured for his distinguished service to cricket as a player, role model and commentator, to the community through charitable initiatives, and for philanthropic contributions. Warne was honoured as Officer of the Order of Australia.

55.title: Wife fell silent after film screening, asked 'Should you do such films': Rajpal
55.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav said his wife fell silent after screening of one of his films. "I asked her 'Is everything okay?'...and her response was...'Should you do such kind of films?' She didn't like the film or my role," Yadav said. He added he does not feel happy on being called comedian because he feels he's been put into small category.

56.title: Ludhiana govt school teacher booked for stalking girl students
56.article_body: A government school teacher was booked by the Ludhiana Rural Police for allegedly stalking girl students and sending them inappropriate messages on phone. The matter came to light after some students filed a written complaint with the principal. They accused him of calling them at night and forcing them to talk to him. An FIR was registered in the matter.

57.title: Mumbai man's morphed images circulated despite paying double loan amount
57.article_body: A 39-year-old Mumbai resident's morphed images were circulated by fraudsters despite the former paying double the loan amount, which was allegedly given to him without his will. After continuous threats and a morphed image shared with the complainant's relatives, where he is accused of raping a 15-year-old girl, the victim filed a complaint at the Meghwadi Police Station.

58.title: Do something productive: Virat's brother to troll comparing their Instagram followers
58.article_body: Virat Kohli's brother Vikas Kohli responded to a troll who mocked him by comparing his Instagram followers with that of Virat's. The troll remarked that Virat has crossed 200 million followers, while Vikas doesn't even have 1 million followers. "Kid, do something productive...Don't give unnecessary advice here," Vikas responded.

59.title: Google to pay $118 mn to over 15,000 female staff to settle gender pay bias lawsuit
59.article_body: Google has agreed to pay $118 million to over 15,000 female employees to settle a class-action gender discrimination lawsuit. The lawsuit first emerged in 2017 after three women in the US filed a complaint accusing Google of paying its female employees $17,000 a year less than male staff doing the same job. They were originally seeking $600 million in damages.

60.title: Electrical transformer falls as car hits pole in Rajasthan, man burnt alive
60.article_body: A man was burnt alive in Rajasthan's Nagaur district on Sunday when the car in which he was travelling hit a power pole, causing an electrical transformer to fall on the vehicle. Police said a fire was ignited after the fall. Police added that the other occupants of the car managed to escape but the deceased was trapped inside.

61.title: Cong leaders including Gehlot, Adhir Ranjan detained for protesting in Delhi
61.article_body: Congress leaders including Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury were detained after they participated in protest march held by the party on Monday. Party leaders Rajni Patil, Akhilesh Prasad Singh, L Hanumanthaiah and Su Thirunavukkarasar were also detained. Meanwhile, Chowdhury has written to SHO Tughlaq Road alleging manhandling by Delhi Police on way to ED office.

62.title: No tactical sense: Zelenskyy on Russian strike that injured 22
62.article_body: Following a Russian strike in Ternopil's Chortkiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that the strike had "no tactical or strategic sense...as in the vast majority of other Russian strikes." The region's Governor Volodymyr Trush had stated that 22 people were injured in the strike. "Ten people are still in hospitals...This is terror, just terror," Zelenskyy added.

63.title: Person says 'can't enter house' due to parked truck; B'luru police remove it
63.article_body: Following a person's complaint about a cargo truck being parked in front of their house's gate, Bengaluru's Chickpete Traffic police on Monday said that the vehicle has been removed. The person had earlier tweeted that they had filed multiple complaints with the Chickpete traffic police but no action was taken. "We cannot enter our house," the person had said.

64.title: Stop witch-hunt of Muslims: JNUSU protests demolition of activist's house
64.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) on Sunday protested against the demolition of activist and former JNU student Afreen Fatima's house in UP's Prayagraj. Terming CM Yogi Adityanath's administration as "bulldozer raj", the members held placards saying, "Stop the witch-hunt of Muslims." Fatima's father, Mohammad Javed has been arrested over the recent violence in Prayagraj.

65.title: Congress is doing 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar': BJP's Sambit Patra
65.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra said what Congress is doing today is 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar'- celebrating corruption. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED in Delhi. "Congress has yet again tried launching Rahul Gandhi module from the pad of corruption, we assure that he'll meet the same fate, he will fail yet again," Patra added.

66.title: When the match gets tight, Rishabh Pant panics: Wasim Jaffer
66.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said stand-in captain Rishabh Pant "panics a bit" when the match "gets tight". Jaffer added, "We saw something similar in the IPL as well. I feel the more he captains, the better he'll get." Under Pant, India have lost two games in a row against South Africa in the five-match T20I series.

67.title: Efforts made to suppress voices of different ideologies: Sachin Pilot
67.article_body: After permission was denied to the Congress to hold a Satyagraha march in Delhi, party leader Sachin Pilot has accused BJP of suppressing "the voice of people of different ideologies". "People are seeing the way BJP is misusing the central agencies. Cases, which were already closed 7-8 years ago, have been filed against Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi," Pilot said.

68.title: Got a call from 9-yr-old who wants to join Army: Adivi on success of Major
68.article_body: Adivi Sesh, speaking about the success of the Hindi version of his film 'Major', said, "We were underdog in Hindi, suddenly we'd showtime all over." "I'm getting calls from...everywhere. I got a call from...9-year-old who wants to join...Army after watching...Hindi version, not Telugu," he added. 'Major' is based on Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

69.title: Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram' collects ₹300 cr globally in 10 days
69.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has earned over ₹300 crore globally within 10 days of its release, according to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala. "At the end of the second weekend, 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹300 cr...mark at the worldwide box office," Ramesh tweeted. The film collected ₹210 crore across India after collecting ₹46 crore in the second weekend.

70.title: If Chahal thinks 'I'll bowl tight, get wickets', it's not happening: Gambhir
70.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir questioned Yuzvendra Chahal's bowling approach in the second T20I against South Africa, stating that the spinner didn't vary his pace in the game. "If Chahal thinks 'I'll bowl tight and get wickets', it's not going to happen...Chahal needs to have an attacking mindset," added Gambhir. Chahal picked one wicket, conceding 49 runs in the second T20I.

71.title: Fire guts hundreds of vehicles in tow yard in Pakistan's Karachi
71.article_body: A fire broke out in a tow yard in Pakistan's Karachi on Sunday, gutting more than 440 impounded vehicles, including cars and motorbikes. According to officials, fire tenders reached the spot within 15 minutes and the blaze was brought under control in three hours. The police ruled out the possibility of sabotage in the preliminary investigation.

72.title: Amazon ordered to pay ₹200 cr penalty in 45 days after plea against CCI rejected
72.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Monday rejected Amazon's plea challenging the CCI's decision to suspend the approval for the e-commerce company's deal with Future Coupons. It directed Amazon to pay the penalty of ₹200 crore imposed by CCI within 45 days from Monday. Future Coupons Pvt Ltd (FCPL) is a promoter of Future Retail Ltd (FRL).

73.title: Canada criticises its official's visit to Russian embassy for event
73.article_body: Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly on Sunday called a visit by the country's official to the Russian embassy in Ottawa "unacceptable". "No Canadian representative should have attended the event hosted at the Russian embassy and no Canadian representative will attend this kind of event again," she said. She also reiterated Canada's support for Ukraine amid Russia's "egregious invasion".

74.title: CID actor Hrishikesh robbed of cash, documents while travelling on AC bus in Mumbai
74.article_body: CID actor Hrishikesh Pandey was recently robbed of cash, credit cards and other documents while travelling on an AC bus in Mumbai. "Since I've played a CID Inspector, it became a joke how in the show people come to us with cases and we solve them," he said. "I'm hoping that the police department will crack this case," he added.

75.title: Joe Root smashed 10 Test hundreds in last 17 months; Kohli, Smith and Williamson 0
75.article_body: England's Joe Root has smashed 10 Test hundreds in the last 17 months, while Virat Kohli, Steve Smith and Kane Williamson haven't been able to hit a single Test hundred in the time period. Since January 13, 2021, Root has scored 2,355 runs in 42 innings. Meanwhile, Kohli has scored 725 runs in 24 innings, including five fifties.

76.title: Wayne Parnell's 'heart' celebration after Pandya's wicket goes viral
76.article_body: South Africa fast bowler Wayne Parnell's celebration after Hardik Pandya's dismissal in the second T20I in Cuttack has gone viral. Parnell was seen making a 'heart' gesture with his hands after bowling Pandya out for nine runs off 12 deliveries. South Africa defeated India by four wickets to take a 2-0 series lead.

77.title: Patanjali unit withdraws ads on ayurvedic products after complaint by doctor
77.article_body: Kozhikode Divya Pharmacy, attached to Patanjali Ayurved, has withdrawn advertisements of its Ayurvedic products after Kerala-based Dr KV Babu lodged a complaint against ads claiming to cure diabetes, heart and liver diseases. The AYUSH ministry also said it found the ads to be "objectionable and misleading" under provisions of the Drugs and Magic Remedies (Objectionable Advertisements) Act, 1954.

78.title: Israeli trekker goes missing in Himachal Pradesh, search underway
78.article_body: An Israeli trekker has gone missing at Hampta Pass Trek between the Kullu and Lahaul-Spiti districts of Himachal Pradesh. Two Israeli trekkers, identified as Yuvan Cohan and Ran, were completing the trek but one of them, Ran, hasn't reached the Koksar area yet, said an official.

79.title: Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines safe, effective for kids under 5: US FDA
79.article_body: The Food and Drug Administration of the US has said that Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccines appear to be safe and effective for children aged under five. The FDA released its analysis ahead of a meeting scheduled for Wednesday in which outside experts will vote to determine if the vaccine should be approved for children in that age group.

80.title: Denied phone to wish mom on b'day, 14-yr-old boy kills self in B'luru hostel
80.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died by suicide after he was allegedly not provided with a mobile phone by the hostel warden to wish his mother on her birthday in Bengaluru. Reports said that he was not allowed to speak to his family members when they tried contacting him several times. Other students in the hostel reportedly found the boy dead.

81.title: Dad said 'He's singing like shopkeeper': Kishore's son recalls his 1st recording
81.article_body: Singer Amit Kumar, son of Kishore Kumar, recalled his first song recording and said, "He (Kishore) was sitting...with Raj Kapoor." "Dad's attention was both ways, whatever I was singing and whatever Raj ji was telling him," Amit said, adding, "He suddenly told RD Burman 'He's singing like some shopkeeper, he's singing weirdly'...I told him 'why don't you leave'...And they...sweetly left."

82.title: Didn't require someone to start hitting: Iyer on Axar batting ahead of Karthik
82.article_body: Explaining India's decision to send Axar Patel ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the second T20I against South Africa, Shreyas Iyer said they needed someone to rotate strike after they were 90/4 in 12.4 overs. "DK can also do that, but he's been a really good asset for us after 15 overs, where he can straightaway slog the ball," Shreyas added.

83.title: Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven: Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind
83.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind's Suhaib Qasmi said she should be forgiven as per Islam. He added, "Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven. We disagree with the protest that started across the country after Friday prayers against Nupur Sharma and her derogatory remarks."

84.title: We congratulate India for action against those who spoke against Prophet: Bangladesh
84.article_body: Speaking on the controversy over remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Bangladesh information minister Hasan Mahmud said, "We congratulate the Government of India [for taking] legal action against those who said [something] against Prophet Muhammad." He added, "This is an external issue...This is an issue of India and I don't think that we have to say many things about this."

85.title: Bitcoin drops 9% to fall below $25,000 level, its lowest since Dec 2020
85.article_body: Bitcoin dropped as much as 8.9% to $24,903.49, its lowest since December 2020 on Monday. Bitcoin is down more than 43% so far this year (YTD), and is trading far below its record high of $69,000 it had hit in November last year. Meanwhile, Ether dropped more than 8% to $1,303, its lowest since March 2021.

86.title: Bhuvneshwar will be a huge plus for India in T20 WC in Aus: Gavaskar
86.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Bhuvneshwar Kumar was "brilliant" against South Africa in the second T20I. "The white ball doesn't swing that much, in the air or off the surface...he has got that capability," he stated. "To have...him in Australia [for T20 World Cup], where there will [be]...little bit of more carry and bounce...that'll be a huge plus," Gavaskar concluded.

87.title: Hope you fly even higher this year: Tiger on Disha Patani's b'day
87.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, Tiger Shroff shared a video with his rumoured girlfriend Disha Patani to wish the actress on her birthday. In the video, Tiger and Disha can be seen running towards the mat and jumping high up in the air. Along with the video, Tiger wrote, "Hope you fly even higher this year happy birthday action hero!"

88.title: 21 booked for hurling casteist slurs during Dalit groom's procession in Raj
88.article_body: The police have booked 21 people for allegedly hurling casteist slurs and creating ruckus during a Dalit groom's pre-wedding procession in Rajasthan's Kota. The DSP said that "some people belonging to the upper castes, who were apparently drunk", had done so when the procession passed through their locality. Four police personnel were already deployed with the procession, the DSP added.

89.title: Rahul reaches ED office to appear in National Herald case after protest march
89.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday reached the office of Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case. He reached the ED office after protest march by the Congress. News agency ANI reported that he was surrounded by hundreds of party workers. Party workers had earlier gathered at party headquarters to express solidarity with top leadership.

90.title: Mumbai city sinking on an average of 2mm every year: Study
90.article_body: A recent research has found Mumbai to be sinking at an average rate of 2mm annually. The study claims a geological phenomenon known as land subsidence behind this and warns of increased flooding in the city. The study, which analysed land subsidence in 99 coastal cities globally between 2015-2020, found China's Tianjin to be the fastest sinking city globally (5.2cm/year).

91.title: Crypto firm Celsius pauses all transfers, withdrawals citing 'extreme market conditions'
91.article_body: Cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius Network has paused all withdrawals and transfers between accounts due to "extreme market conditions", the company said on Monday. "We're taking this necessary action...in order to stabilise liquidity and operations while we take steps to preserve and protect assets," it added. Notably, Bitcoin tumbled as much as 7% to $25,366, at an 18-month low on Monday.

92.title: Man starts 'first' donkey farm in K'taka, receives orders worth ₹17 lakh for donkey milk
92.article_body: Srinivas Gowda, a 42-year-old native of Ramanagara, has started the 'first' donkey farm in Karnataka after quitting his job in a software company. The farm will have 20 donkeys to start with, Gowda said. Srinivas said that he will sell donkey's milk to be used for beauty products, adding that he has already received orders worth ₹17 lakh.

93.title: You could feel India's drive going down in 2nd T20I vs SA: Zaheer
93.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said he could feel India's "drive" going down during Heinrich Klaasen and Temba Bavuma's fourth-wicket partnership in the second T20I. "It was evident on the field...[This] is the thing Rahul Dravid and Co. need to address," Zaheer added. Klaasen and Bavuma added 64 runs, helping SA to chase down India's 149-run target in 18.2 overs.

94.title: LIC shares decline by 3.2%, hit a record low at ₹681.71
94.article_body: LIC shares hit a new record low as the lock-in period for anchor investors in the country's largest IPO ended today. While the stock opened at ₹691 a share, it touched a fresh all-time low of ₹681.71 on the BSE intraday, 3.2% down from its previous close. Notably, this was the tenth consecutive session when the stock was trading lower.

95.title: Varun hugs a specially-abled fan, poses with him for pics; video surfaces
95.article_body: A video shared by photographer Viral Bhayani shows actor Varun Dhawan posing with a specially-abled fan for pictures. In the video, the fan can also be seen hugging Varun and giving a peck on his cheek. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Varun is one of the kindest actors in Bollywood," while another fan wrote, "This made my day."

96.title: Russia blows up bridge linking Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk city
96.article_body: The Russian forces blew up a bridge connecting Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to another city across the river, said local officials on Sunday. This has cut off a possible route for evacuation of civilians, they added. "About 500 civilians remain on the territory of the Azot plant in Sievierodonetsk, 40 of them are children," said Luhansk Governor Serhiy Gaidai.

97.title: Man loses control of 2-wheeler, hits 2 women; Cyberabad Police retweet video
97.article_body: The Cyberabad Police retweeted a video, shared by the Medak District Police, of a man driving a two-wheeler. The man can be seen losing control of the vehicle and hitting two women who were walking on the side of the road. Towards the end of the video, the man can be seen lying on the road after the accident.

98.title: Satyendar Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody in alleged money laundering case
98.article_body: The Rouse Avenue court in Delhi on Monday sent AAP leader and Delhi minister Satyendar Jain to 14-day judicial custody in an alleged money laundering case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate said it recovered ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins after conducting raids on Jain and his associates. Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on May 30.

99.title: Undeclared emergency in Delhi: Surjewala ahead of Rahul's ED appearance
99.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s appearance before the ED in Delhi on Monday, party leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said "coward" PM Narendra Modi-led government has imposed an undeclared emergency in Central Delhi. "The coward Modi government has deployed many police barriers and police personnel…This proves that the Modi government is shaken by Congress," Surjewala added.

100.title: Over 4,000 International Driving Permits issued to Delhi residents since Feb
100.article_body: The Delhi transport department has issued 4,286 International Driving Permits (IDP) from February till June 7, 2022. According to the data, 1,150 were given for the United States and 986 were given for Canada in 2022, followed by Great Britain (442) and the UAE (335). Notably, 439 IDPs were issued in June to residents of Delhi who had moved abroad.

101.title: Twitter user posts video of man stealing scooter in Hyd, tags police
101.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video of a man stealing a scooter from a street in Hyderabad. While tagging Hyderabad Police, the user wrote, "Sir, One Activa bike...was stolen from Shahalibanda new road...on 12th June under...@shohussainialam...kindly put some special teams to recover this bike as soon as possible as till now no FIR has been issued."

102.title: Mr Bean was self-centred, narcissistic anarchist: Rowan Atkinson
102.article_body: British actor Rowan Atkinson, speaking about his character Mr Bean, has said that the character was a "self-centred, narcissistic anarchist". Rowan will be playing Trevor in his upcoming series 'Man Vs Bee'. While comparing Trevor to Mr Bean, Rowan said, "Trevor is different. He is a much nicer and much sweeter and more normal person."

103.title: BJP's cronyism has crossed Palk Strait: Rahul on power project claim
103.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said BJP’s "cronyism" has crossed Palk Strait and moved into Sri Lanka. His statement came after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani’s Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims.

104.title: Pune residents with no pipeline gas connections get bills: Report
104.article_body: Some residents in Pune's Akurdi, Baner and Aundh have recently received pipeline gas bills despite them not having Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) connections, reported Hindustan Times. "We received a bill of ₹2,697. I've sent a complaint to MNGL but there is no response," a resident said. "It doesn't happen frequently...we resolve the issue immediately," MNGL MD Deepak Sawant said.

105.title: I love working with Saif, I find him very funny: Vikram Vedha co-star Radhika
105.article_body: Sharing her experience of working with Saif Ali Khan in 'Vikram Vedha', actress Radhika Apte said that she loves working with him, adding that she finds him very funny. "I'm only laughing on the sets," she added. Radhika has previously worked with Saif in 'Sacred Games' and 'Baazaar'. Radhika further said she had a great time working with Hrithik Roshan.

106.title: Man kills father, runs over 4 cyclists, jumps into river in Germany
106.article_body: A 37-year-old man killed his father and ran over four cyclists while trying to escape the scene in Germany's Mannheim city on Sunday, said police. The suspect then left his damaged vehicle, fled on foot and jumped into the Rhine river, added police. One of the cyclists, a 71-year-old woman, was killed, while the others were taken to hospitals.

107.title: Klaasen targeted spinners well, his execution was very good: Shreyas
107.article_body: Shreyas Iyer, speaking about South Africa batter Heinrich Klaasen's knock in the second T20I, has said, "Klaasen targeted our spinners...well. He played shots off good lengths." Klaasen scored 46-ball 81 runs to help South Africa beat India by four wickets in the second T20I. "I don't think our bowlers did much wrong...It was just...Klaasen's execution was very good," Shreyas stated.

108.title: Delhi districts asked to increase COVID tests; enforce masks: Officials
108.article_body: Amid a rise in the number of COVID-19 cases being reported daily, the Delhi government has asked the district administrations to restart random testing at public places, officials quoted by Hindustan Times, said. The districts have also been asked to increase the number of booster vaccinations and focus on enforcing measures like masking and social distancing, reports said.

109.title: It's not possible: Shakti Kapoor after son Siddhanth gets detained for consuming drugs
109.article_body: After his son Siddhanth Kapoor was detained for consuming drugs at a rave party in a Bengaluru hotel, actor Shakti Kapoor said, "I can only say one thing...it's not possible." Siddhanth was taken to Ulsoor Police Station after he tested positive for drug usage. As per police, five other people at the party also tested positive for drug usage.

110.title: Kuwait to deport expats over protest against Nupur Sharma's Prophet remarks
110.article_body: Kuwait will be deporting expats who took part in a demonstration against the remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Prophet Muhammad after Friday prayers. The protesters violated the laws and regulations of the country which stipulate that sit-ins or demonstrations by expats are not to be organised in Kuwait. They will be banned from entering Kuwait again.

111.title: Pune ATM machine catches fire as thieves try to cut it open, ₹3.98 lakh burnt
111.article_body: According to police, ₹3.98 lakh cash was burnt during an attempt to steal money from an ATM in Pimpri Chinchwad on Sunday. Police added that the accused tried to cut open the ATM machine using a gas cutter. However, the machine caught fire and the money inside it was burnt. Two CCTV cameras and some furniture were also damaged.

112.title: RBL Bank shares drop by 18% after appointment of new MD & CEO
112.article_body: Shares of RBL Bank tanked by 18% in Monday's early trade to their 52-week low of ₹92.9 after the appointment of the bank's new MD and CEO. On Saturday, R Subramaniakumar was announced as the bank's MD and CEO for a period of three years, six months after Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down from the position due to the RBI's intervention.

113.title: Car with 5 who went for parathas in Murthal rams truck in Delhi; 2 die
113.article_body: Two persons were killed and three others injured after their car rammed into a stationary truck in Delhi's Swaroop Nagar. The deceased have been identified as Sachin Sapra and Ram Kumar, both aged 26. According to the police, the friends drove to Murthal to have parathas and the accident occurred while they were returning.

114.title: 51-yr-old man sells newborn grandson for ₹60,000 in K’taka’s Davanagere
114.article_body: Four persons were arrested for selling a newborn baby boy for ₹60,000 in Karnataka’s Davanagere, officials said. "A 19-year-old woman…gave birth to a baby boy on June 6," SP, Davanagere, CB Ryshyanth, said. The woman's 51-year-old father sold the baby for ₹60,000, he added. "We got back the baby and handed him to the child welfare commission," the SP stated.

115.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to trade at 52,843, Nifty below 15,800
115.article_body: BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points to 52,843 and Nifty dipped by 417 points to 15,784 in Monday's early trade. Falling up to 4.02%, Bajaj twins, ICICI Bank and SBI were the top Sensex losers. Notably, the Rupee hit an all-time low after it crossed 78 per US dollar for the first time ever in Monday's early trade.

116.title: Haryana man signals petrol pump staff about being kidnapped in SUV, 2 held
116.article_body: Two people were arrested after a man from Ambala, while being kidnapped in his own SUV along with his friend, signalled petrol pump staff of the situation. The victim, Sanjeev Kumar, said three men had taken lift in SUV. One of the men then pointed a knife at Sanjeev and his friend and demanded ₹50 lakh to let them go.

117.title: Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth detained for consuming drugs at rave party
117.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor was detained during police raid at a rave party in a Bengaluru hotel on Sunday night. As per Bengaluru Police, Siddhanth was among the six people to have tested positive for drug usage. The police raided the hotel after a tip-off and reportedly sent samples of 35 people for drug test.

118.title: DCP posted in Delhi suspended for using forged certificates
118.article_body: A DANIPS officer, posted as Deputy Commissioner of Police in Delhi, has been suspended for allegedly using forged birth and education certificates to be eligible for the UPSC exam. A case of cheating and forgery was filed against him by the CBI in 2020. He is said to have used documents belonging to another person with the same name.

119.title: His knock was phenomenal, one of the best I've seen: Miller on Klaasen's 81(46)
119.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has praised his teammate Heinrich Klaasen for his 81-run innings against India in the second T20I. "His knock was phenomenal and one of the best I've seen. The conditions in which he played and...to do what he did made it easy for us," stated Miller. South Africa chased down India's 148-run total in 18.2 overs.

120.title: UP CM has become Allahabad HC's Chief Justice: Owaisi on demolition in Prayagraj
120.article_body: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed’s property was demolished by UP government, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said UP CM Yogi Adityanath is behaving like the "Chief Justice" of Allahabad HC. "He'll convict anyone and demolish their houses?" Owaisi asked. "The house which was demolished is in the name of the wife of accused, who is a Muslim woman," he stated.

121.title: Rupee crosses 78 per US dollar for the 1st time ever, hits record low
121.article_body: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global oil prices, the Rupee crossed the 78-mark against the US dollar for the first time on Monday. It opened 30 paise lower at 78.14 per US dollar on Monday as against closing at its weakest level of 77.93 in Friday's session. Notably, US inflation climbed to a 40-year high at 8.6% in May.

122.title: Section 144 imposed in Ghaziabad till Aug 10; directions issued for social media use
122.article_body: Section 144 has been imposed in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad district till August 10. The District Magistrate of Ghaziabad said that gatherings without permission will not be allowed during this period. Directions for social media use have also been issued and social media group admins have been asked to inform the administration about rumour-mongers.

123.title: India reports 8,084 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 47,995
123.article_body: India has reported 8,084 COVID-19 cases, 4,592 recoveries, and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,582 COVID-19 cases and four deaths. Active cases in India increased to 47,995, while the death toll reached 5,24,771.

124.title: Fire incidents in Delhi in May jumped by 54% compared to 2021: DFS
124.article_body: The number of fire incidents reported in Delhi in May this year was 54% more than compared to May 2021. The data shared by the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) reveals that 3,362 fire incidents were reported in May this year while 2,174 were reported last year. DFS chief Atul Garg said usually they receive more fire calls during summer.

125.title: Congress workers protest over Rahul's ED summon in Delhi; detained
125.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday detained some Congress workers as they held a protest in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi ahead of his appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. Videos of the party workers being detained have surfaced online. Earlier, the Delhi Police had denied Congress permission to hold a rally over the same.

126.title: Heavy lifting needed in Air India, expect visible progress in 1-2 yrs: Chandrasekaran
126.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran while speaking about the transformation at Air India said that there "are lots of issues that need heavy lifting". He added, "There is no magic wand... A lot of work needs to be done on IT systems, processes...We want to make Air India the flagship company...In the next 12-24 months, there will be visible progress."

127.title: Delhi Police warns of traffic amid 'special arrangement', share list of areas to avoid
127.article_body: The Delhi Police advised commuters to avoid some routes in view of "special arrangements" on Monday. "Avoid Gol Methi junction, Tughlak Road Junction...Claridges Junction...Q-point Junction, Sunehri Masjid Junction...Maulana Azad Road Junction and Man Singh Road Junction between 7am & 12pm," police said. Police also advised public to avoid Motilal Nehru Marg, Akbar Road, Janpath & Man Singh Road.

128.title: I'm not taking any extra measures to make my skin look different: Masaba
128.article_body: Fashion designer-actress Masaba Gupta has said she's not taking any extra measures to make her skin look different from what it is. "I'm not taking any extra steps to make my body look smaller than what it is," she added. "I'm not trying to fit people's idea of what I should be like if I'm an actor," Masaba further said.

129.title: It was a tricky chase, but we were confident: Bavuma after win vs India
129.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said it was a "tricky chase" but they were confident of winning after restricting India to 148/6 in the second T20I on Sunday. "Bhuvneshwar bowled well, he made the ball talk upfront...[but] we knew we had to execute our plans and had to be clinical," he added. SA's Heinrich Klaasen scored 81(46) in the match.

130.title: Delhi records 42°C+ max temp on 25 days this summer, highest in 10 yrs
130.article_body: According to data by India Meteorological Department (IMD), Delhi has recorded maximum temperature of 42 degrees Celsius and above on 25 days so far this summer. This is highest number of such days in ten years since 2012, IMD data said. Reports said in 2012, the city recorded a maximum temperature of 42 degrees Celsius or above on 30 days.

131.title: My fans give me strength to keep going: Kriti on 13 yrs in films
131.article_body: Actress Kriti Kharbanda completed 13 years in the film industry. Taking to Instagram, the actress thanked her fans and wrote, "I work hard for me, but I know you're the reason I don't give up on bad days...you guys...give me the strength to keep going...I love you for that!" Kriti made her acting debut in the 2009 Telugu film 'Boni'.

132.title: Traffic fines halted in Pune after complaints on police conduct
132.article_body: The collection of traffic fines has been put on hold in Pune after several complaints were made against the conduct of traffic police and towing vehicle operators. The traffic policemen have been accused of rude behaviour. Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said, "We are trying to streamline the system. Meanwhile, an inquiry is being conducted into the complaints."

133.title: 5 killed, 16 injured in multiple shooting incidents in US' Chicago over weekend
133.article_body: As many as five people were killed and 16 injured after US' Chicago witnessed multiple shooting incidents over the weekend. Among the five people who were killed was 31-year-old rapper FBG Cash. A woman accompanying him also suffered gunshot wounds and was hospitalised. Others killed were in their 20s.

134.title: We were 10-15 runs short, could've bowled better: Pant after defeat vs SA
134.article_body: After Team India's second defeat against South Africa in the five-match T20I series, captain Rishabh Pant said, "I hope we improve in the next game. We need to win all the remaining three games now." On four-wicket defeat in the second T20I, Pant said, "We were 10-15 runs short...[we] bowled well [initially]. But...we weren't up to the mark."

135.title: 73-year-old man dies after car hits his bike in Pune; 1 booked
135.article_body: A 73-year-old man died after a car knocked down his bike in front of a research laboratory on a service road in Pune's Pashan. An assistant inspector said that the 25-year-old female car driver has been booked in the matter and will be produced before a court on Monday. The incident took place on Friday around 4 pm.

136.title: Totally illegal: Ex-CJ of Allahabad HC on demolition of UP violence accused's house
136.article_body: Speaking on the demolition of the house of Prayagraj violence accused Mohammad Javed by UP government, former Allahabad High Court Chief Justice Govind Mathur said, "This is totally illegal." He added, "It's impermissible that you demolish a house on a Sunday when the residents are in custody. It is not a technical issue but a question of rule of law."

137.title: Explosion occurs during washing machine repair in Pune flat
137.article_body: An explosion occurred in a flat in Pune's Bhavani Peth while a washing machine was being repaired. The blast reportedly shattered the glass windows of the flat, but there were no casualties. The Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) and police arrived at the scene after the blast and the resident was taken into custody.

138.title: Sharpshooter allegedly involved in Sidhu Moosewala's killing arrested from Gujarat
138.article_body: Pune Police have arrested Santosh Jadhav, a sharpshooter allegedly involved in the killing of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala, from Gujarat. The police also apprehended Jadhav's aide, who is also a suspect in the murder case. Moosewala was shot dead by assailants in Jawaharke village of Punjab's Mansa district on May 29.

139.title: Bidding for IPL TV and digital rights cross ₹43,000-crore mark on Day 1
139.article_body: On Day 1 of the IPL media rights e-auction, the TV rights bid reached ₹57 crore per game and the digital rights bid stood at ₹48 crore per game. While a total of 410 matches are planned from the 2023-2027 IPL cycle, the media rights value per game stood at ₹105 crore and ₹43,050 crore for the five-year period.

140.title: As stolen 2-wheeler runs out of fuel, man robs 14-yr-old of scooter in Punjab
140.article_body: A man allegedly robbed a 14-year-old girl of scooter in Punjab's Mohali after his scooter, that was found to be stolen from Amritsar, ran out of fuel. Police said the girl, while returning from grocery store, stopped to see if the man needed any help. The man tried to snatch her phone and drove away with her scooter, police added.

141.title: Delhi govt to turn Asola Bhatti sanctuary's mining pits into reservoirs
141.article_body: Delhi government has planned to transform 14 mining pits inside the Asola Bhatti wildlife sanctuary into reservoirs to solve the waterlogging crisis faced by surrounding areas. A committee will be set up to prepare the project's master plan in next 30 days, officials said. The government is also planning to turn the area overlooking Neeli Jheel into an eco-tourism spot.

142.title: My ex-husband Ritesh has hacked my social media, he's taking revenge: Rakhi
142.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant has filed a complaint after her social media accounts were allegedly hacked by her ex-partner, Ritesh. In a few viral videos, Rakhi was seen crying inconsolably as she reached the Oshiwara police station. The actress was accompanied by her boyfriend Adil Khan. She said, "He's in revenge mode...He wants to...ruin my relationship with Salman Khan Bhai."

143.title: The universe has given me second chance: Sonali on starring in The Broken News
143.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share a post about making a comeback with 'The Broken News'. Sharing a video, Sonali wrote, "I see this as a beginning because I think the universe has given me a second chance and I need to make good on it!" "I'm no longer an accidental actor. I’m choosing to do this," she added.

144.title: Hima beats Dutee to win 100m at 61st National Interstate Athletics C'ships
144.article_body: Indian sprinter Hima Das won a gold medal in women's 100 metres at 61st National Interstate Athletics Championships in Chennai on Saturday. She won with a timing of 11.43 seconds. Olympian Dutee Chand came second, clocking 11.44 seconds. Following her win 22-year-old Hima said, "Happy to make a comeback after an injury and hard work of nearly two years."

145.title: Rare albino Galapagos giant tortoise born in Swiss zoo, pics released
145.article_body: A rare albino Galapagos giant tortoise was recently born at a Swiss zoo and made its public debut this month. It's part of a pair of newborn tortoises at the zoo. While one of them is black in colour like its parents, the other one is albino. The two babies' genders haven't been determined yet.

146.title: Heinrich Klaasen records highest T20I score by a South Africa batter against India
146.article_body: South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Heinrich Klaasen on Sunday recorded the highest score in a T20I against India by a South Africa batter. The 30-year-old scored 81 runs off 46 deliveries in the Cuttack T20I to set the record. Quinton De Kock had held the previous record, scoring 79*(52) in Bengaluru on September 22, 2019.

147.title: Silence of liberals on death threats against Nupur deafening: Gambhir
147.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on Sunday condemned the threats issued against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her remarks against  Prophet Muhammad. "Silence of so called 'secular liberals' on the sickening display of hatred and death threats throughout the country against a woman who has apologised is surely deafening," he said. Gambhir added that he didn't support her statements.

148.title: Let's protect their childhood: Harbhajan on World Day Against Child Labour
148.article_body:
On the occasion of World Day Against Child Labour on Sunday, Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "On this World Day Against Child Labour, let us all come together and protect the innocence and childhood of our children." He added, "They [children] deserve to enjoy their early years and we
 all can make it happen with a combined effort."

149.title: Chiranjeevi comes on board for Ranbir & Alia starrer Brahmastra: Reports
149.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi has reportedly come on board for actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer- 'Brahmastra'. According to reports, the makers will soon make an official announcement about his association. Reports added that the film's director Ayan Mukerji recently flew to Hyderabad to have a meeting with the actor and finalise the details.

150.title: Plenty of new opportunities for Indian business in Russia: Envoy
150.article_body: There are plenty of new opportunities for Indian business in Russian market, especially after many western countries' withdrawal, said Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov. The multidimensional cooperation between India and Russia is among the world's "most elaborate ones", he said. Priority is being given to early conclusion of free trade pact between the Eurasian Economic Union and India, he added.

151.title: Rajnath, Nadda to hold talks with other parties for Presidential poll
151.article_body: The BJP has said that Union Minister Rajnath Singh and BJP chief JP Nadda will hold consultations on behalf of the party with political parties on the upcoming Presidential election. BJP said they will begin holding these consultations soon. The Presidential election is scheduled to be held on July 18 and the votes will be counted on July 21.

152.title: Afghanistan take unassailable 2-0 lead after 2nd T20I win vs Zimbabwe
152.article_body: Afghanistan beat Zimbabwe by 21 runs in the second T20I in Harare to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Afghanistan posted 170/5 in 20 overs, with batter Najibullah Zadran top scoring (57) for the side. Zimbabwe managed to score 149/7 in 20 overs. Third and final T20I will be played on Tuesday.

153.title: North Korea fires suspected artillery shots into sea: South Korea
153.article_body: North Korea fired multiple suspected artillery shots in the sea on Sunday, the South Korean military said. South Korea maintains a firm military readiness in close coordination with the US amid boosted surveillance on North Korea, it added. Notably, the show of force comes a day after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to boost the country's military power.

154.title: Video of woman being beaten by several men at restaurant sparks outrage in China
154.article_body: A video showing some women being assaulted by a group of around nine men at a restaurant has been widely shared on Chinese social media, sparking outrage. The attack began after one of the men touched a woman's back and she pushed him away. She was dragged outside and thrashed. Women who tried to help her were also beaten.

155.title: India's first display manufacturing facility to be set up in T'gana
155.article_body: Elest has signed an agreement with Telangana government to set up India's first display manufacturing facility worth ₹24,000 crore. The facility will manufacture displays for smartphones, tablet computers, laptops, etc. The government is confident that the facility will be a major boost for state's electronics and IT ecosystem and its ancillaries, said Telangana Industries Minister KT Rama Rao.

156.title: India lose their 2nd T20I match in a row as South Africa take 2-0 series lead
156.article_body: South Africa defeated India by four wickets in the second T20I in Cuttack to take a 2-0 lead in the five-match series. India have now lost two T20I matches in a row after having won 12 straight T20I matches. South Africa restricted India to 148/6 in their 20 overs, before chasing down the target in 18.2 overs.

157.title: IAS officer shares Patna University notice full of grammatical errors, calls it 'appalling'
157.article_body: Sanjay Kumar, a 1990 batch IAS officer and the Secretary of Youth Affairs in the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, shared a Patna University circular and said, "The grammar and syntax used is appalling for a professor." "All Research Scholars must be mark signature in attendance register otherwise absent mark in attendance register," the notice read.

158.title: Harry Styles fan falls from balcony during his concert in Scotland; survives
158.article_body: During singer Harry Styles' concert in Glasgow, a man reportedly fell from the top tier of a stand at Ibrox Stadium on Saturday. Several people, who witnessed the man falling, tweeted about it on Twitter and said it was "traumatising". Reports added that the man landed on other people in the lower tier but managed to avoid serious injuries.

159.title: 11 injured in bee attack at Pune fort, 4th incident since March
159.article_body: Around 11 tourists were injured in a bee attack at Pune's Sinhagad Fort on Sunday afternoon, officials said. Local officials said that some of the injured in the attack are children. This is the fourth time swarms of bees have attacked visitors at the state's tourist sites since March. Of the 11, two were given treatment on the spot.

160.title: Turkey's concerns on Finland, Sweden's NATO bid valid: NATO chief
160.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said on Sunday that Turkey's security concerns over Finland and Sweden's membership in the bloc are valid. "These are legitimate concerns. This is about terrorism, it's about weapons exports," Stoltenberg said during a visit to Finland. Turkey has raised concerns over the Nordic countries' membership bid, stating that they have ties with a Kurdish militant group.

161.title: No pardon for UK citizens who fought for Ukraine: Separatist leader
161.article_body: The leader of Ukrainian breakaway region of Donetsk People's Republic said on Sunday that there's no reason to pardon two British nationals who were sentenced to death recently for fighting on behalf of Ukraine. Aslin and Pinner, along with Moroccan national Brahim Saadoun, were convicted of mercenary activities and terrorism. UK has criticised the judgement and called it a "sham".

162.title: Tiger kills 50-year-old man in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district
162.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed by a tiger in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district on Sunday, an official said. He had gone to the forest along with his wife and mother to collect wood to build a fence around his residence, the official added. "After his mother and wife raised an alarm, the feline disappeared from the spot," the official further said.

163.title: Films like Heropanti & Baaghi have lost its audience: Director Sabbir Khan
163.article_body: Filmmaker Sabbir Khan said that the films 'Heropanti' and 'Baaghi' were not made with the intent to turn them into a franchise. "They were organic films. For me, a sequel is something where you take the story and characters forward," he added. Sabbir further said that he hasn't seen sequels of 'Heropanti' and 'Baaghi' as they've lost their audience.

164.title: We request the US to stop smearing us: China
164.article_body: Speaking at the Shangri-La Dialogue, Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe said, "We request the US side to stop smearing and containing China. Stop interfering in China's internal affairs." He added that the bilateral relationship cannot improve unless the US side can do that. This comes after US President Joe Biden said US would respond "militarily" if China attacked Taiwan.

165.title: India lose 0-5 to Belgium in their 2nd leg tie at Women's Pro Hockey League
165.article_body: Indian women's hockey team lost to Belgium 0-5 in the second leg of their FIH Hockey Pro League tie in Antwerp, Belgium, on Sunday. They lost the first match against Belgium 1-2 on Saturday. India will next face Argentina on June 18 and 19 in Rotterdam, Netherlands. With 22 points from 10 matches, India are currently third in the standings.

166.title: Iran's currency hits record low against US dollar amid sanctions
166.article_body: Iran's currency on Sunday dropped to its lowest value ever against the US dollar amid American sanctions over the Iranian nuclear programme. Traders in Iran's capital Tehran exchanged the rial at 3,32,000 to the US dollar. Notably, the Iranian currency was trading at 32,000 rials to the dollar at the time of Iran's 2015 nuclear deal with world powers.

167.title: Sikh man selling fuel at $500 loss a day in US, says 'not here to make money'
167.article_body: A Sikh gas station owner in US is selling fuel to his customers at a lower price than his purchase cost amid rising costs. Jaswiendre Singh said he's suffering a loss of about $500 per day by selling nearly 3,785 litres of gas. He said, "We're not here to make money right now. I'm very happy to help other people."

168.title: Sri Lanka plans to introduce weekly fuel rationing from next month
168.article_body: Sri Lanka plans to introduce a weekly fuel rationing scheme from next month, Sri Lankan Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said on Sunday. The restriction will remain in place until steady supply of fuel is resumed in the country, he added. Notably, the move comes amid an economic crisis that has led to a shortage of fuel in Sri Lanka.

169.title: Joe Root smashes his 27th Test hundred, equals Kohli, Smith's tally
169.article_body: Former England captain Joe Root smashed his 27th hundred in Test cricket by reaching the three-figure mark off 116 deliveries in the first innings of the second Test against New Zealand. With this, Root equalled the tally of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith. Root also became the 12th highest run-scorer in Test cricket, surpassing Sunil Gavaskar's tally of 10,122 runs.

170.title: Illegal guns found in home of Prayagraj violence accused before it was razed: Police
170.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police found .12 bore and .315 bore illegal pistols and cartridges from the home of Prayagraj violence main accused Javed Mohammed before demolishing it on Sunday, Senior Superintendent of Police Ajay Kumar said. Javed was arrested on Saturday for his role in the protests over remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Police said inappropriate material was recovered from his home.

171.title: I'd commit to doing it for 17 more in a heartbeat: Chhetri on 17th anniversary of debut
171.article_body: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri penned a note on Instagram on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of his India debut. He wrote, "It's been an honour that I cannot explain in words, to have worn the national team shirt for 17 years." He added, "I'd commit to doing it for 17 more in a heartbeat."

172.title: Ukraine's grain exports via Poland, Romania has bottlenecks: Minister
172.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy Foreign Minister Dmytro Senik said on Sunday that country has established two routes via Poland and Romania to export grains, but they have bottlenecks that have slowed supply chain. Senik added that global food security was at risk due to Russian invasion. Ukraine is unable to export grains due to a Russian blockade at its Black Sea ports.

173.title: Kanpur violence well-planned conspiracy: VHP General Secretary
173.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad's General Secretary Milind Parande on Sunday expressed concern over the Kanpur violence last Friday and described it as a "well-planned conspiracy". Violence had erupted on June 3 in Kanpur following Friday prayers over suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad in a television debate.

174.title: CID actors Dayanand, Shraddha Musale, Aditya Srivastava have reunion, share pics
174.article_body: The cast of the show 'CID' including Shraddha Musale, Dayanand Shetty, Aditya Shrivastava, Ajay Nagrath and Dinesh Phadnis reunited but for a get-together. Sharing pictures from the evening, Shraddha wrote, “Such evening...Nostalgic stories...leg-pulling, conversations. Great to have you all home. Being a weekday, travelling at...peak hours with so much traffic and still on time."

175.title: Kartik Aaryan supported 'Shehzada' financially: Producer Bhushan Kumar
175.article_body: Film producer Bhushan Kumar spoke about celebrities hiking their fees and its impact on films. Bhushan revealed that actor Kartik Aaryan has always been supportive in this case. "He has always been like that. For our next film, Shehzada, we were having some problems. But Kartik stood by us," Bhushan said. "He supported us financially as well," Bhushan added.

176.title: Red Bull's Verstappen wins Azerbaijan F1 GP after Leclerc's engine failure
