176.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won Azerbaijan Formula One Grand Prix on Sunday and extended his championship lead after an engine failure on Charles Leclerc's Ferrari, while Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished second. Leclerc was leading when he retired with a smoking engine on the 20th lap after Ferrari teammate Carlos Sainz suffered the same fate. Mercedes' George Russell finished third.

177.title: Mumbai reports 1,803 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate at 11.32%
177.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,803 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Sunday, a day after recording 1,745 fresh cases. The city also saw two deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 11.32%. The number of active cases has risen to 10,889 from 10,047 reported on Saturday, as per a health bulletin.

178.title: Delhi reports 735 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, 3 deaths
178.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 735 fresh COVID-19 cases, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 19,12,798. Three people succumbed to the virus, taking the overall death toll to 26,221. This is the third consecutive day that Delhi has recorded over 600 cases. There are currently 2,442 active cases in the city.

179.title: Under what law?: Tharoor after razing of violence accused's property in UP
179.article_body: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's property was demolished by Uttar Pradesh government, Congress' Shashi Tharoor asked under what law and following what process was the property razed. "Has UP exempted itself from the Constitution of India?" Tharoor tweeted. "Cops carrying out custodial torture receive laurels but being a vocal Muslim is a crime," AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said.

180.title: Haryana CM residence to be known as Sant Kabir Kutir: Khattar
180.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday announced that his official residence in Chandigarh will be known as Sant Kabir Kutir. Khattar also said the provision of "cadre-wise reservation" during promotions will be introduced for state government employees. He added that free railway tickets will be provided to those travelling to Banaras, the birthplace of Sant Kabir.

181.title: 25-yr-old Pakistani soldier killed in shootout with militants
181.article_body: A 25-year-old Pakistani soldier was killed during a gunfight with militants in the North Waziristan district that borders Afghanistan, Pakistan's military said in a statement on Sunday. The security forces quickly started a search-and-clearance operation to locate militants who fled, it added. However, no militant group immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

182.title: 16-yr-old dies by suicide after friends mock him over defeat in PUBG
182.article_body: A 16-year-old allegedly died by suicide in Andhra Pradesh after his friends mocked him after he lost in the online game PUBG. The boy, who was the son of a local Congress official, was hooked on the online game. District Congress president Thantiya Kumari requested the central government to prohibit PUBG-style games since they are taking lives, reports said.

183.title: Over 14,000 acres area damaged due to wildfires in Pak: Report
183.article_body: An area of over 14,000 acres was reportedly damaged in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa after more than 200 wildfires continued to rage in the province over the last two weeks. The area includes forests and pastures, a media report stated. Around 55 blazes were started intentionally by people, while causes of another 143 blazes are unknown, according to a government report.

184.title: Putin's rumoured girlfriend seen in public for the 1st time since western sanctions
184.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva was recently seen in Sochi, making it the first time she was seen in public since she was sanctioned by several western nations.  A video has shown the 39-year-old Olympic gold-winning gymnast interacting with children. She was sanctioned by the UK in May, followed by Canada and the EU.

185.title: Messi, Ronaldo are on a different level to anyone else out there: Gerrard
185.article_body: Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard has said Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo are on a different level to everyone else in the game. "But Ronaldo doesn't get in my team...Ronaldo will win you things but I am more about a team player than an individual player, so I'll always go down that road," he added.

186.title: Train vandalised in Bengal amid fresh incidents of violence over Prophet remarks
186.article_body: People protesting against BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammad damaged a local train in Bethuadahari railway station in West Bengal's Nadia district on Sunday, police said. An officer said that services on the Lalgola line have been affected due to the attack. Violence was also reported in North 24 Parganas and Murshidabad districts.

187.title: Russia destroyed warehouses with 3 lakh tonnes of grains: Ukraine
187.article_body: Russian shelling last weekend may have destroyed up to 3 lakh tonnes of grains stored in Ukrainian warehouses, Ukraine's Deputy Agriculture Minister Taras Vysotskyi claimed on Saturday. The warehouses, which mostly held wheat and corn, are located in the Black Sea port of Mykolaiv, Vysotskyi said. The Russian forces have blockaded Ukrainian ports amid the war.

188.title: SAD's Parkash Singh Badal admitted to hospital in Mohali, is stable
188.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has been admitted to a private hospital in Mohali, a party spokesperson confirmed on Sunday. The 94-year-old was admitted on Saturday after he vomited but his condition is stated to be stable now. Badal was admitted to another hospital on June 6 due to gastric-related problems but was discharged the following day.

189.title: 8 policemen suspended after lapse in security of UP CM Yogi
189.article_body: Eight policemen were suspended after a lapse in security of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath while he was on his way to welcome BJP chief JP Nadda at Gorakhpur Airport on Friday. Those who have been suspended include an Inspector and a Sub-Inspector. When Adityanath was going to receive Nadda, many vehicles had come in front of his fleet.

190.title: Businessman Jindal's pics used in reports on ex-BJP leader, JSPL issues statement
190.article_body: Businessman Naveen Jindal was misidentified as expelled BJP leader Naveen Jindal in some media reports, Jindal Steel and Power Limited (JSPL) said. "We urge all to avoid the mistake....refrain from using photographs or social media handles of our Chairman with regards to the concerned matter," said JSPL. The businessman is "in no way related" to the issue, it clarified.

191.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature on Sunday released
191.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has released the list of cities that recorded maximum temperature of 44°C or more. Delhi's Ridge recorded the highest maximum temperature of 45.8°C, followed by Haryana's Hisar at 45°C. Other cities include Rajasthan's Ganganagar (44.8°C), Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi (44.6°C), Jharkhand's Daltonganj (44.6°C) and Rajasthan's Churu (44.5°C).

192.title: No power on Earth can force India on any issue: Piyush Goyal
192.article_body: After attending the G-33 Ministerial Meeting in Geneva, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said, "No power on Earth can force India and the Modi government on any issue whatsoever." "No one can pressurise today's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'. We can face any challenge. We don't take any decision under pressure," he stated.

193.title: Rishi ji & I broke up during the shoot of song Parda Hai Parda: Neetu
193.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor recalled shooting for song 'Parda Hai Parda' with her late husband, actor Rishi Kapoor. "Rishi ji and I were at loggerheads...We used to fight...with each other and had broken up at that time," she said. "It was a romantic song where I had to throw...rose but what was going in my mind was something else," she added.

194.title: It became difficult to enjoy tennis: Andreescu on her mental health break
194.article_body: Talking about why she took a mental health break, 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu said she had gone through so much chaos that it became difficult to listen to herself and enjoy tennis. "Being away from the sport made me realise that I truly loved it," she added. Andreescu played her first match in seven months in April 2022.

195.title: 75 ministers to perform yoga across 75 locations on Int'l Yoga Day
195.article_body: As many as 75 ministers from the Central government will perform yoga across 75 locations in India to mark International Yoga Day on June 21. PM Narendra Modi will perform yoga at Mysore Palace, while Home Minister Amit Shah will participate in yoga programs at Nashik's Trimbakeshwar temple complex. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will perform yoga at Delhi's Jantar Mantar.

196.title: Lineman cuts power supply of police station after SI fines him
196.article_body: After a lineman was fined by a Sub-Inspector for not wearing a helmet, he cut the power supply of the police station where the official was deployed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. The lineman alleged that the power connection was illegal. He said he will lodge a power theft complaint against the police official.

197.title: Centre misusing agencies to suppress Opp'n voices: Chhattisgarh CM
197.article_body: Responding to the summons issued by the ED to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said that the Centre is misusing agencies like CBI, IT to suppress the Opposition's voice. "I will be going to Delhi today as Rahul Gandhi has to appear in front of the ED tomorrow," he said.

198.title: Apple to allow different payment options in dating apps: Dutch watchdog
198.article_body: Netherlands' Authority for Consumers and Markets (ACM) said Apple will allow different payment methods in Dutch dating applications, thereby meeting the requirements set by the watchdog. ACM's Chairman of the board Martijn Snoep said Apple avoided its responsibility of keeping the digital economy's market "fair and open". This dispute also led to Apple being fined €50 million by the ACM.

199.title: 2 Army soldiers missing for 2 weeks, presumed to have fallen into a river
199.article_body: Naik Prakash Singh and Lance Naik Harender Singh, deployed in the forward areas of Anjaw district in Arunachal Pradesh, have been missing for two weeks. They are "presumed to have accidentally fallen into a fast-flowing river in close proximity to their post", the PRO, Tezpur said. The search operations have been ongoing for the last two weeks, it added.

200.title: 'Modi pressured Rajapaksa to give project to Adani,' says SL official; revokes claim
200.article_body: A top Sri Lankan official has claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani's Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims made in front of a parliamentary panel, saying he was "emotional". Rajapaksa's office also issued a statement "vehemently denying" influencing anybody in awarding the project.

201.title: Ukrainian troops defying expectations in war, says Zelenskyy
201.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that the Ukrainian forces are defying expectations by preventing Russian troops from overrunning eastern Ukraine. Zelenskyy also said that he is proud of the Ukrainian defenders managing to hold back the Russian advance in the Donbas region. Russia had launched a fresh offensive in eastern Ukraine in April.

202.title: She had best of everything, yet succumbed to depression: Upasana on designer Prathyusha
202.article_body: Entrepreneur Upasana Kamineni, who's married to actor Ram Charan, mourned the death of celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella saying, "My bestie my dearest friend. Gone too soon." Upasana added, "She had the best of everything, career, friends and family- yet succumbed to depression...I believe karmic baggage passes through lifetimes." Garimella was found dead at her home on Saturday.

203.title: Villagers in Bihar hold BJP MLA hostage over development work delay
203.article_body: BJP MLA Kumar Shailendra was held hostage inside a school in Bihar's Lokmanpur village on Sunday. Shailendra, who was visiting the village to spread awareness about Centre's projects, was held captive for two hours as villagers were upset over delayed development works. "[Villagers] said that until....flood management [work] doesn't begin, they won't let me leave," Shailendra wrote on Facebook.

204.title: We got one-dimensional, too predictable: McDonald on Aus' 3rd T20I loss
204.article_body: Following Australia's four-wicket loss in third T20I against Sri Lanka, Australia head coach Andrew McDonald said the side was a little "one-dimensional" and "too predictable" at certain periods. "And probably went away from what made us really good in...first two games, albeit we weren't defending a total," he added. Australia won the series 2-1, having won the first two matches.

205.title: Tens of thousands demand stricter gun control measures in US
205.article_body: Tens of thousands of people called for stricter gun control measures in protests across the US on Saturday. The protests come after a string of deadly mass shootings in the country recently. Notably, more than 19,300 people have died in gun-related incidents in the country so far this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

206.title: Umran is most exciting prospect I've seen in last 10 years: Vengsarkar
206.article_body: Dilip Vengsarkar has said pacer Umran Malik deserves to play for India following his recent performance in IPL 2022. "He's one of the most exciting prospects I've seen in the last 10 years. I hope he does well because he looks very fit...has that aggression of a fast bowler," he added. Umran took 22 wickets in 14 matches in IPL.

207.title: Delhi man fakes own abduction as parents oppose his relationship
207.article_body: A 24-year-old man, identified as Gaurav Mishra, faked his own kidnapping in Delhi after his parents opposed his relationship. Police used CCTV footage, mobile tracking to track Gaurav down, who later confessed to his crime. "As Gaurav Mishra had given false information to parents and police and misused government machinery, appropriate legal action is being taken against him," police said.

208.title: Minor domestic help jumps to death after she's caught stealing in Mumbai
208.article_body: A 16-year-old girl working as a house help in Mumbai's Nagpada died by suicide after jumping from her employer's house on the 16th floor of Orchid Tower. Police said the girl jumped after she was caught stealing by her employers. Police have registered an accidental death report and booked the minor's employers under the Child Labour Act.

209.title: South Africa to bowl first against India in 2nd T20I, playing XIs announced
209.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I. South Africa have made two changes to their playing XI, with injured Quinton de Kock and Tristan Stubbs being replaced by Heinrich Klaasen and Reeza Hendricks. India are playing with the same XI.

210.title: Never asked dad about his 4 marriages, it was his life: Amit on Kishore Kumar
210.article_body: Late singer Kishore Kumar's son Amit Kumar said he never asked his father about his four marriages. "It was his personal life. He always wanted a family," Amit added. "He was a family man. It was just that he was misunderstood," Amit said. Amit also revealed his step-mom Leena writes songs for him. "She is a brilliant writer," he added.

211.title: Changes needed in process to issue Aadhaar card: Bengaluru Police
211.article_body: After busting a gang that allegedly used fake stamps to create gazetted officer's letter in Bengaluru, police said they'll ask Unique Identification Authority of India to make changes to address verification process for issuing Aadhaar cards. The gang allegedly helped illegal migrants, especially from Bangladesh, to get Aadhaar cards and other citizenship-related documents by using fake stamps.

212.title: Even Fadnavis will vote for us if ED control given to Shiv Sena: Raut
212.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that if the control of the ED is given to his party, then even BJP's Devendra Fadnavis will vote for Sena. Raut's comments came following the recently concluded RS elections in Maharashtra. He had previously alleged that BJP was using central agencies to put pressure on smaller parties to vote for them.

213.title: Wife of ex-Chambal dacoit elected as sarpanch unopposed in MP
213.article_body: Former Chambal dacoit Malkhan Singh's wife, Lalita Rajput, has been elected as sarpanch by people of Sungayayi village in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district. Lalita was elected unopposed even as panchayat elections in state are supposed to commence on June 25. "There's no light or road or sewerage so I want to work for the development of my village," Lalita said.

214.title: Wild elephant kills 47-year-old man in Chhattisgarh
214.article_body: A wild elephant on Saturday evening killed a 47-year-old man in Chhattisgarh's Gaurela-Pendra-Marwahi district, a forest official said on Sunday. The elephant lifted Ramdhan Gond with its trunk, flung him to the ground and trampled him, the official added. Notably, four people have been killed in elephant attacks in the district since March this year.

215.title: Inspiration for others: MP CM meets woman who fought her attackers
215.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday met the woman, who was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men in Bhopal and called her an "inspiration for others". CM gave compensation of ₹1 lakh and said that the state government will bear her medical expenses. "Plastic surgeons and doctors will take care of her," he added.

216.title: It might be for last time to see Kane lead NZ Test side in 3rd Test: Doull
216.article_body: Ex-New Zealand pacer Simon Doull said if Kane Williamson, who tested COVID-19 positive ahead of second England-New Zealand Test, is fit to play and captain the side in third Test, it might be for the last time in Test cricket. "It's time for Tom Latham to take over this Test...side," he added. In Williamson's absence, Latham was appointed as captain.

217.title: Iran & Venezuela sign 20-year cooperation plan amid US sanctions
217.article_body: Iran and Venezuela signed a 20-year cooperation plan during Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's visit to Tehran on Saturday. The countries, both of which are under US sanctions, will cooperate in the fields of oil, petrochemicals, defence, agriculture, tourism and culture. "Venezuela has shown exemplary resistance against...threats from...imperialists," Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said.

218.title: Govt loses appeal against order in Reliance, Shell dispute: Report
218.article_body: The Centre has lost its appeal in the English HC against a $111 million arbitration award in Reliance and Shell's favour in a cost recovery dispute, PTI reported. The case pertains to a production sharing contract signed between Reliance, Shell and the Centre for oil, natural gas production. Government should've objected when Arbitration Tribunal passed initial orders, the HC said.

219.title: Bodies of 2 missing friends fished out of stone quarry in Pune
219.article_body: The bodies of two men, aged 20 and 21, were fished out of a stone quarry in Pune's Dhanori area. The men, who were residents of Vishrantwadi, were friends and had gone missing on June 8. Some locals saw the bodies floating in the stone quarry, following which a team of Pune Fire Brigade reached the spot.

220.title: UK town 'swallowed up' by sea discovered after over 650 years, say scientists
220.article_body: Scientists believe they have found the 'lost' British town of Ravenser Odd over 650 years after it was "swallowed up" by the North Sea in 1362. The sunken town, called 'Yorkshire's Atlantis', was earlier believed to be at the bottom of the sea. But a new search using sonar equipment has revealed rocks and stoneworks closer to the water's surface.

221.title: Dutch MP shares screenshots of death threats he received for supporting Nupur Sharma
221.article_body: After tweeting in favour of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma amid controversy over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Dutch MP Geert Wilders said that he received hundreds of death threats. Sharing screenshots of some of the death threats, Wilders wrote, "It makes me even more determined and proud supporting her. For evil may never win. Never."

222.title: You gave me the confidence to carry the bald look: Mahima to Anupam
222.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry took to Instagram to share that actor Anupam Kher motivated her to carry the bald look. "I've had...many people who met me recently say they never noticed I was wearing a wig," she added. "I've had...friends with alopecia and scanty hair ask me where they can get good wigs. [If] you want one, wear one," Mahima said.

223.title: 21-yr-old kidnaps minor girl from Goa labour camp; held in Gurugram
223.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram on Sunday for allegedly kidnapping a minor girl from a highway project labour camp in Goa, a police official said. The accused, identified as Anil Rawat, stayed with the victim in the same camp, said DSP (Pernem) Siddhant Shirodkar. "The father of the victim had filed a complaint last week," he added.

224.title: Houses of 2 accused who attacked woman with blade demolished in MP
224.article_body: The houses of two men who allegedly attacked a woman with a blade for resisting eve-teasing in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal were demolished on Sunday. The accused were arrested by the police on Saturday. The 32-year-old woman had received 118 stitches on her face. Her one eye is not opening and she's not able to speak, police said.

225.title: China's nuclear arsenal only for self-defence, says Defence Minister
225.article_body: Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe on Sunday claimed that China will only use its nuclear weapons for self-defence and never use them first. "China has developed its capabilities for over five decades. It's fair to say there has been impressive progress," he said. He also said that the ultimate goal of China's nuclear arsenal was to prevent nuclear war.

226.title: Dutch startup unveils ₹2 crore solar car that can run for months without charging
226.article_body: Dutch startup Lightyear has unveiled its first solar-powered electric car, which it claims can be driven for up to seven months without charging. Dubbed 'Lightyear 0', the car features 53.8 sq ft of curved solar panels across its hood and roof and is priced at €250,000 (over ₹2 crore). The startup claims it is the world's first production-ready solar car.

227.title: Chances of major waterlogging in Navi Mumbai are minimal: NMMC Commissioner
227.article_body: The Municipal Commissioner of the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation Abhijit Bangar has said that the chances of major waterlogging in Navi Mumbai are "minimal". "Unless there is an excessive rainfall accompanied with high tide, the chances of...major waterlogging [are] minimal as, during the past two months, most of the pre-monsoon nullah cleaning work has been completed," Bangar said.

228.title: ED's summons to Rahul Gandhi 'baseless': Cong leader Chidambaram
228.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday stated that the summons issued by the ED to former party chief Rahul Gandhi is "baseless". He said that a money laundering case involves money and laundering of money, which didn't happen. "It is like accusing a person of the offence of 'purse snatching' when there was no purse and no snatching," he added.

229.title: Hardik is the most valuable T20 cricketer in world cricket right now: Hogg
229.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is the "most valuable T20 cricketer in the world right now". "Hardik should be captain of [India's] T20 team in front of Rahul...He proved his worth in the IPL," added Hogg. Hardik scored unbeaten 31 off 12 balls in the first T20I against South Africa.

230.title: BJP clarified respecting all religions is its priority: UP minister on Prophet remarks
230.article_body: Amid the ongoing violence over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the party’s action clarified that respecting all religions is its priority. "Our party and our government believe in unity and respect of all religions. They are going to work together with all parties," he added. "We should talk about peace," Ansari stated.

231.title: 25-year-old law student who hit biker & ran away in Delhi gets bail
231.article_body: The driver of a Mahindra Scorpio who hit a biker and ran away following a verbal altercation near South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been granted bail by a Delhi court. Anuj Chaudhary, a 25-year-old law student, was arrested a day after the incident's video went viral on social media. Chaudhary was granted bail as the biker hadn't sustained serious injuries.

232.title: IIT-B study recommends measures to prevent railway line flooding in Mumbai
232.article_body: IIT Bombay has come up with a study where it has suggested measures to prevent water flooding, especially on Mumbai's railway tracks during monsoon. The study has recommended sewer systems and underground water holding ponds to prevent flooding. Notably, the mitigation assessment was conducted in Dadar, Lower Parel and Kurla areas of the city to understand the issue.

233.title: You can't say opener can't bat in different roles: Shan on Babar Azam's comment
233.article_body: Reacting to captain Babar Azam's remarks that he's a top-order batter and it would be "unfair" to play him in the middle-order in ODIs, Pakistan batter Shan Masood said, "An opener plays cricket in all phases." He added, "You can't say [opener] doesn't know how to bat in different roles." Shan wasn't included in their squad for West Indies ODIs.

234.title: Congress is making huge drama: BJP on Rahul, Sonia's ED summons
234.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra on Sunday accused Congress of making a "huge drama" about Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's respective summons to Enforcement Directorate (ED) with regard to National Herald Case. "Present yourself in front of ED and accept the wrongdoing...Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," Patra said. Rahul Gandhi is slated to appear before the ED tomorrow.

235.title: Don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open to non-customers: Starbucks CEO
235.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz recently said the company is considering ending its open bathroom policy. Citing safety concerns, he said the coffee giant might no longer allow people who are not customers to use their stores' bathrooms. "We have to harden our stores and provide safety for our people...I don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open," Schultz added.

236.title: Chhetri, Samad's goals give India win over Afg by 2-1 in AFC qualifiers
236.article_body: India defeated Afghanistan by 2-1 in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers in Kolkata on Saturday. The two goals for India were scored by skipper Sunil Chhetri and midfielder Sahal Abdul Samad. At the end of 90 minutes, the scoreline was 1-1 before Samad scored a goal in the extra time. Notably, India will play against Hong Kong on June 14.

237.title: 5-yr-old boy out for walk with sister in Maha attacked by dogs, dies
237.article_body: A five-year-old boy, who had stepped out of his home for a walk with his sister in Maharashtra's Nagpur, was attacked and killed by stray dogs, reports said. Reports added that while the boy's sister tried to shoo the dogs away, they dragged him to a construction site, where he was mauled to death.

238.title: 3 die due to heat at religious festival in Bengal, CM condoles deaths
238.article_body: Three devotees died due to heat and humidity during the 'Danda Mahotsav' at the ISKCON temple in West Bengal's Panihati. North 24 Parganas District Magistrate said the situation is under control. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condoled the deaths and said that all help is being provided to people on the spot.

239.title: Villagers in Thane oppose acquisition of land for Mumbai Metro carshed
239.article_body: Villagers from Thane's Bhayander region have opposed acquisition of their cultivable lands for construction of Mumbai Metro Line 9's carshed. About 300 property owners and their kin will be affected by the acquisition, said Bhumiputra Samajik Samanvay Sanstha President Ashok Patil. Government authorities want to acquire villagers' land instead of a privately held plot in the vicinity, Patil said.

240.title: Britain's Queen Elizabeth becomes world's 2nd-longest ruling monarch
240.article_body: Britain's 96-year-old Queen Elizabeth II on Sunday overtook Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej to become the world's second-longest reigning monarch in history. The UK has been celebrating the Queen's Platinum Jubilee to mark 70 years since her coronation in 1953. France's Louis XIV remains the longest-ruling monarch with a 72-year reign from 1643 to 1715.

241.title: How much did the previous IPL media rights cost?
241.article_body: Sony Pictures Networks India had held the media rights for the first 10 years of IPL (2008 to 2017), for which it paid about ₹8,200 crore. Star India had won the IPL media rights for 2018 to 2022 cycle for ₹16,347 crore. The BCCI has set the reserve price at ₹32,890 crore for the 2023-27 cycle of the IPL.

242.title: Address being shared, family has threat from Islamic fundamentalists: Naveen
242.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's leader Naveen Jindal who was expelled after his remarks on Prophet, took to Twitter to say his family faces threat from Islamic fundamentalists. "It is my humble request to everyone...do not share any kind of information about me and my family members with anyone...many people are posting my residence address on social media," the tweet read.

243.title: Video shows reversing car running over a 2-yr-old twice in TN; boy survives
243.article_body: A two-year-old boy has survived after being run over by a reversing car twice within seconds near Tamil Nadu's Rasipuram on Saturday. A video of the incident shows the boy playing on the street at the time of the incident. Police said the boy suffered fractures and his intestine was damaged in the incident.

244.title: Got scared after watching Big Brother, thought I'll be eliminated: Shilpa
244.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty, who participated in 'Big Brother', said that she initially got scared about the show. "I saw a couple of episodes and I got scared with what I saw. I said, 'I am not going to do all of this'," she added. "I honestly felt like I'll go, and I'll get eliminated in the second week," Shilpa said.

245.title: Rural development began when PM Modi came to power in 2014, says Shah
245.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the aspect of rural development is to make villages convenient. "Gandhi Ji had said country’s soul resides in villages. Thus, if you’ve to make this country complete and independent, you’ll have to do it for the villages. This (rural development) began when PM Modi came to power in 2014," Shah added.

246.title: MP milkman, wife kill son, die by suicide; daughter survives incident
246.article_body: A milkman and his wife killed their son in Madhya Pradesh before also killing themselves. Reports said that they also tried to kill their daughter who survived the incident. The man's brother said that he was in distress due to abetment of suicide case on him and other members of the family.

247.title: NCB seizes 4.8 kg of charas from water purifier in Mumbai, 2 held
247.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai has seized 4.88 kg of charas concealed in a special cavity made inside a water purifier, an official said on Sunday. The water purifier was to be sent to Australia through a courier service, the official added. The NCB has apprehended the consignor and a courier agent on Saturday, the official further said.

248.title: Exxon made more money than God this year: US President amid high oil prices
248.article_body: US President Joe Biden accused the US oil industry and Exxon Mobil of capitalising on high oil and gas prices as inflation soared to a 40-year high in the country. He said, "Exxon made more money than God this year." He added that US oil companies are not using higher profits to drill more but to buy back stocks.

249.title: Fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis: BJP's Sambit Patra ahead of Rahul's ED date
249.article_body: A day before Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, BJP's Sambit Patra said Congress is making "a huge drama" out of it. "Why this drama of press conferences…What is this Satyagrah? Gandhiji would be shamed to see this fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis," Patra added. "Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," he stated.

250.title: PM to inaugurate Sant Tukaram temple in Pune, security tightened
250.article_body: Security has been tightened for PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune on June 14, during which he will inaugurate the Sant Tukaram temple. The entry of the devotees into the Sant Tukaram temple will be allowed in a restricted manner on Sunday and Monday and it will be barred on Tuesday, the trustees said.

251.title: Ruturaj's strike rate in first 10 balls is very low, that's a problem: Aakash
251.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad's strike rate at the start of his innings is a "problem" for India in the T20Is against South Africa. "Gaikwad goes at a strike rate of 80-90 in the first 10-12 balls. After that, if he plays a big knock then fine, else he pegs you back a little bit," explained Aakash.

252.title: Hyd Police arrest 3 for cheating people of ₹8 cr in govt scheme scam
252.article_body: Hyderabad's Ghatkesar Police along with Malkajgiri Special Operations team (SOT) have arrested three persons who were absconding in a cheating case. The accused would reportedly target people belonging to SC, ST and OBC communities, for whom government has introduced various welfare schemes. The accused had allegedly collected ₹8 crore from people in guise of 'deposits' for the beneficiary amount.

253.title: High time PM breaks silence on rising Islamophobic cases: Tharoor
253.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said it is high time PM Narendra Modi breaks his silence on the proliferation of Islamophobic incidents in the country. Tharoor's comments came following controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by two BJP leaders. "I think our current hate speech laws and Section 295A are quite adequate to deal with such misbehaviour," Tharoor said.

254.title: $5 trillion GDP goal appears to be case of shifting goalposts: Chidambaram
254.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader P Chidambaram said that the BJP-led Centre's "goal of a $5 trillion GDP appears to be a case of shifting goalposts". "The original target year was 2023-24...We are nowhere near that goalpost," Chidambaram said. He added, "Now, the Chief Economic Adviser has said we will achieve the goal by 2027."

255.title: Chhattisgarh BJP leader booked over alleged 'fake' coal theft video
255.article_body: Chhattisgarh BJP Secretary Om Prakash Choudhary was booked on Saturday following a complaint alleging that the coal theft video he posted was "fake". The purported video, which went viral, showed people digging and carrying away coal from an opencast coal mine in Korba. The District Collector had "accepted that coal theft was going on", Choudhary said reacting to the FIR.

256.title: France holds first round of parliamentary elections on Sunday
256.article_body: The first round of the parliamentary elections is taking place in France on Sunday. President Emmanuel Macron, who recently won the presidential election, is seeking a majority for his coalition in the National Assembly. More than 6,000 candidates are in fray for 577 seats in the National Assembly. The second and final round will be held on June 19.

257.title: Top 10 most valued firms lose ₹2.29 lakh cr in m-cap in past week
257.article_body: The top 10 most valued firms lost ₹2.29 lakh crore in market capitalisation (m-cap) in the past week, with LIC taking the biggest hit after losing ₹57,272.85 crore in m-cap. LIC was followed by Reliance Industries, which witnessed a fall in m-cap of ₹44,311.19 crore, and Hindustan Unilever Limited, losing ₹21,674.98 crore in m-cap. Reliance remains India's most valued firm.

258.title: 22 injured as missiles hit military facility in Ukraine: Governor
258.article_body: As many as 22 people were injured after missiles destroyed a military facility in Ukraine's Chortkiv, said Volodymyr Trush, Governor of the Ternopil region, on Sunday. "All missiles were from the Black Sea. A military facility and civilian facilities were partially destroyed," he said. Four apartment buildings had been damaged in the attack, he added.

259.title: Thousands of sheep drown as overladen ship sinks off Sudan's coast
259.article_body: An overladen ship crammed with thousands of sheep capsized on Sunday off Sudan's Red Sea coast drowning the animals on board but with all crew surviving, port officials said. The livestock vessel was heading from Sudan's port of Suakin to Saudi Arabia. "It was carrying 15,800 sheep, which was beyond its load limits," an official said.

260.title: Combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights crosses ₹40,000-crore mark: Reports
260.article_body: The combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights has crossed the ₹40,000-crore mark, as per reports. With this, the media rights value of the league has more than doubled as compared to 2018-2022 media rights value that was won by Star India for ₹16,347 crore for TV and digital rights. The winners will be announced on Monday.

261.title: Heatwave to reduce in 4 states/UTs; IMD releases list
261.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted that heatwave conditions will continue in isolated pockets over Punjab, Haryana, Delhi and southeast Uttar Pradesh during next two days, but will reduce after that. Heatwave conditions are also likely over east Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand on June 12 and 13 and in Jammu division on June 12.

262.title: Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell for over 45 hrs, rescue op underway
262.article_body: The rescue operation is underway to get an 11-year-old boy out of a borewell in Chhattisgarh even after over 45 hours. The boy is conscious, officials said. The boy fell into the 80-feet-deep abandoned borewell in the backyard of his house in the Janjgir-Champa district of the state on Friday.

263.title: India beat Olympic champions Belgium in shootout at Men's Pro Hockey League
263.article_body: Goalkeeper PR Sreejesh saved a penalty stroke in the shootout as India defeated Olympic champions Belgium 5-4 in first match of the two-legged FIH Men's Pro Hockey League on Saturday. India were down 1-3 with just eight minutes left in the match but held Belgium 3-3 to force a penalty shootout. Sreejesh was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

264.title: Govt setting up communication with minorities to hear their problems: UP minister
264.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the state government is starting 'Qaumi Chaupals' in the state to set up communication with the minorities and hear their problems. "Started 'Qaumi Chaupal' to create awareness about schemes for minorities on the ground level," Ansari added. "We're setting up communication with them so we may also hear their problems," he stated.

265.title: BMC tells residents to take precautions amid rising malaria cases
265.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has asked residents to take precautions against malaria amid a rise in cases in Mumbai. In the first five days of June, the city has reported 57 cases of malaria and 10 cases of dengue. Notably, the city had reported 950 malaria cases and 94 dengue cases until June 5 this year.

266.title: You took it personally to heart: Moeen to Cook over viral on-air clash in January
266.article_body: Referring to their on-air clash that went viral in January, Moeen Ali told Alastair Cook, "You took it personally to heart." Moeen said, "I was basically saying that Joe Root had a lot more empathy for players than you did and I never mentioned once that you're not a good captain or if you are or aren't better than Root."

267.title: IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League: Sourav Ganguly
267.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly, in a recent event, said that IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League. "I’ve seen the game evolve...where players like me earned a few hundreds and now have the potential of earning crores," Ganguly said. He added, "It makes me feel happy and proud that the sport I love has evolved to become so strong."

268.title: IAS officer scolded by HC judge over dress code, asked 'Is this a cinema hall?'
268.article_body: A video showing a Bihar IAS officer being scolded by a Patna High Court judge during a court hearing has been widely shared online. "You don't know in what dress code you've to appear in the court?...Do you think this is a cinema hall?" Justice PB Bajanthri is heard asking Bihar Principal Secretary for Housing and Urban Development Anand Kishor.

269.title: 295 Maoist sympathisers, militias surrender in Odisha: Police
269.article_body: The Odisha Police said 295 active Maoist militias, Maoist sympathisers, members of the local village committee and members of the Maoist frontal organisations surrendered before police in Malkangiri. "The villagers who surrendered were involved in several exchanges of fire, arson cases, civilian killings, hoisting of black flags instead of national flag and burning of vehicles," an official said.

270.title: Illegal liquor vend busted in Gurugram, 1 arrested
270.article_body: An illegal liquor vend was busted in Gurugram and one person was arrested, police said on Saturday. The excise department and the Chief Minister's flying squad, acting on a tip-off, conducted a joint raid and seized a large quantity of liquor, police added. An FIR has been registered against the owners at Manesar Police Station, they added.

271.title: PM's silence is baffling: Chidambaram on ex-BJP leaders' Prophet remarks
271.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders, saying, "The PM's silence is baffling, but in tune with his silence on past occasions." Moreover, on being questioned about foreign countries condemning the remarks, he replied that the PM should have "spoken and acted immediately after the offensive utterances".

272.title: Noida authority razes 27 farmhouses built on Yamuna floodplains
272.article_body: Noida authority on Saturday demolished 27 farmhouses built illegally in an area of 15 hectares on the Yamuna floodplains, officials said. The land is worth around ₹60 crore and is located in villages like Nagla Nagli and Nagli Wajidpur in Sector 135, they added. More such illegal constructions will be razed soon, said Noida authority's OSD (Land) Prasun Dwivedi.

273.title: India should play first 3 T20Is vs SA with same team: Ashish Nehra
273.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra said Team India should play with the same playing XI in the first three T20Is against South Africa unless there is a "drastic change" in conditions. He stated Cuttack also has a high-scoring pitch. "India should learn from the defeat in the first game and move to the second one without panicking much," Nehra stated.

274.title: 5 killed after truck hits car, bike in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
274.article_body: Five people were killed and two got injured after a container truck collided with a car and a bike near Akodia village of Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The truck collided with the car first and then hit the bike-borne three youths 50 metres ahead, police said. Out of the five deceased, three on bike were college students aged between 20-22 years.

275.title: BJP MLA shares video of police beating 9 men with sticks in UP, calls it 'return gift'
275.article_body: After protests over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks, BJP MLA Shalabh Mani Tripathi has shared a video of police beating up nine men with sticks and wrote, "Return gift for rioters." The video shows the men crying in pain as police beat them in what seems to be a police station. Meanwhile, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav condemned the act.

276.title: 7 govt doctors put on duty to treat DM's sick cow in UP's Fatehpur
276.article_body: The Chief Veterinary Officer of Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, Dr SK Tiwari, has directed seven veterinary doctors to treat the ailing cow of District Magistrate Apurva Dubey. In an official letter, the officer has directed the doctors to check the cow daily in the morning and in the evening. The order also mentions that any laxity will be unpardonable.

277.title: Ex-world no. 1 Murray reaches 1st final on grass in 6 years at Boss Open
277.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray defeated Nick Kyrgios 7-6(7-5), 6-2 at the Boss Open in Stuttgart to enter his first tour-level final on grass in six years. The Brit won his semi-final in one hour 31 minutes. Unseeded Murray will face second-seeded Matteo Berrettini, who beat German Oscar Otte 7-6(9-7), 7-6(7-5), in the final on Sunday.

278.title: Will get into the mind of Dhoni if I get mind reading power: Karthik
278.article_body: During an interaction for BCCI, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he would get into the mind of ex-India captain MS Dhoni if he gets the ability to read minds. On being asked to choose between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, Karthik said, "Messi, I think he is slightly different and I enjoy watching him in the little that I have watched."

279.title: I enjoy intimacy, don't have to keep it a secret at my age: Imtiaz on 'She'
279.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali, while speaking about turning intimacy director for his upcoming series 'She', said that like every Indian, he enjoys intimacy. "I am at an age where I don't have to keep my interest in intimacy a secret," Imtiaz added. He also said that there is a lot of potential dramatically in intimacy.

280.title: Hyd Police nab 3 interstate drug traffickers; seize MDMA, cocaine
280.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested three drug traffickers on the outskirts of Choutuppal and seized narcotic substances, including cocaine and MDMA pills, and ₹60,000 cash from them. The accused, who are part of an interstate drug syndicate supplying contraband substances from Goa to Andhra Pradesh, were caught following a tip-off. One of the accused is yet to be arrested.

281.title: Foreign investors withdraw net ₹14,000 crore in 8 days in June
281.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have withdrawn ₹14,000 crore from Indian equity markets in eight trading sessions in June. With this, the total net outflow by FPIs so far this year has reached ₹1.81 lakh crore, data with depositories showed. FPIs sold net ₹40,000 crore from Indian equity markets in May, ₹17,144 crore in April and ₹41,123 crore in March.

282.title: Shraddha's makeup artist gets injured on sets of Luv Ranjan's film in Spain
282.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor’s makeup artist, Shraddha Naik, injured her leg on sets of Luv Ranjan’s film in Spain. Taking to Instagram, Naik shared a video from the shoot and revealed that she suffered a ligament tear and was put in a cast for 10 days. Alongside it, she wrote, "They said 'Break a leg in Spain' I took it seriously."

283.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut to release in US on Sept 2
283.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut will receive a theatrical release in US and Canada on September 2. The film's official Twitter handle announced, "Spider-Man: No Way Home: The More Fun Stuff Version swings into movie theatres in the US...Canada September 2! More countries to be announced soon!" The film also features Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield.

284.title: Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour: Ayushmann
284.article_body: On World Day Against Child Labour, actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said, "Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour." Ayushmann is UNICEF's celebrity advocate for the Ending Violence Against Children campaign. "Children belong in schools and playgrounds, not workshops, factories, agricultural fields or as domestic labourers," he added.

285.title: Ex-Barcelona footballer Prince marries Italian model on Moon in metaverse, pics surface
285.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Kevin Prince Boateng, commonly known as Prince, married Italian model Valentina Fradegrada on Moon in the metaverse. "I wanted to do something special for Valentina, something that nobody had ever done. Thanks to OVER, we can celebrate our love like no one has done before, in a space location," Prince had earlier said.

286.title: US-based electric scooter startup fires 23% of its employees
286.article_body: US-based electric scooter startup Bird has fired 23% of its employees. Bird reportedly told a website that it has a headcount of about 600 people, meaning almost 140 employees will be affected. The layoffs will range from senior managers to new hires, said a Bird spokesperson. In 2020, Bird had fired 30% of its workforce on a Zoom call.

287.title: Chemical thrown on woman allegedly raped by Raj minister's son, told to drop case: DCW
287.article_body: The 23-year-old woman who had accused Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son of rape in Jaipur and Delhi was attacked with a chemical by some "unidentified persons", the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) told police. "They...threatened her to withdraw her rape case," said DCW. The woman alleged that the accused persons told her 'This is just a trailer', during the attack.

288.title: Names, addresses asked before killing, how to live safely: Kashmiri Pandit
288.article_body:
While talking about the recent killings in Kashmir, a Kashmiri Pandit, as quoted by The Quint, said,
"We have seen minority killings earlier too, but this time, militancy has taken the form of targeted killings. They ask for names and addresses before killing. How can we live safely there?" He added he fears to be killed while sitting in office.

289.title: Binny Bansal sells 0.72% stake in Flipkart worth ₹2,060 crore to Tencent: Report
289.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal has sold a 0.72% stake in Flipkart to China-based tech conglomerate Tencent through its European subsidiary, PTI reported citing official documents. The stake is valued at $264 million (over ₹2,060 crore) as per Flipkart's last valuation of $37.6 billion. The transaction was reportedly completed last year, and disclosed to the government in current financial year.

290.title: BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron detected in 37-year-old man in Pune
290.article_body: A 37-year-old man from Pune has tested positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron. The man has been fully vaccinated and he returned from England on May 21. "The patient, who had mild symptoms, was diagnosed with COVID-19 on June 2 and cured after being in home isolation," Maharashtra surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate has said.

291.title: Man going to Golden Temple with family shot dead in Amritsar
291.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Sunday while he was going to visit the Golden Temple with his wife and two children. The victim, identified as Harinder Singh, had returned from Dubai, where he worked, just five days ago. His wife said that the attackers tried to snatch their valuables which led to a scuffle.

292.title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised in Delhi over COVID-related issues
292.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi due to issues related to COVID-19, party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "She's stable and will be kept at the hospital for observation," he added. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate had issued fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23.

293.title: Crypto market value declines to $1.1 trillion as Bitcoin drops to $27,000 level
293.article_body: The value of global crypto market declined more than 8% to $1.1 trillion as major cryptocurrencies traded in the red on Sunday. Bitcoin, the largest crypto by market value, fell 6.29% to $27,454, whereas Ethereum plunged as low as $1,450, its lowest level since March 2021. The decline comes after US inflation hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May.

294.title: Hardik can score 70-80 in 30 balls, send him ahead of Pant: Chopra
294.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya has the ability to score 70-80 runs off 30 deliveries. "I feel you should send Hardik...whenever a wicket falls after the 10th-12th over," Chopra said. "If you give Hardik 30 balls...he is going to give you a 70 or 80...You can send him ahead of Rishabh Pant," Chopra added.

295.title: It's just unbelievable what Rafael Nadal has achieved: Roger Federer
295.article_body: Tennis player Roger Federer praised Rafael Nadal after the latter won the 14th French Open title.  "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved. The record of Pete Sampras, which I beat, was 14 Grand Slam titles. Now Rafa has won the French Open 14 times," Federer stated. "I was happy for him that he did it again," he added.

296.title: Philippine Defense Secretary faints during Independence Day event
296.article_body: Philippine Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Sunday morning fainted during an Independence Day ceremony at Rizal Park. He later shared a picture of himself at a hospital saying, "My lack of rest and sleep from my recent...international security engagements may have taken its toll...I'm fine now." Delfin was advised to rest following the incident, Defense spokesperson Arsenio Andolong said.

297.title: Stuart Broad shares pic of major fire at his pub, says 'Not sure I still can believe it'
297.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to Instagram to share picture of major fire at his pub. He wrote, "I couldn’t believe the news...Not sure I still can." He added, "Thankfully no one was hurt, the Nottinghamshire Fire Service were incredible in their efforts & thank you to the villagers for the wonderful support & sorry for the disruption."

298.title: AAP announces new Gujarat unit, Kishorbhai Desai named state chief
298.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday announced the new office-bearers for its Gujarat unit. Kishorbhai Desai has been named as the State President, while Manoj Sorathiya has been appointed as State General Secretary. The party also appointed Gujarat leader Isudan Gadhvi as the National Joint General Secretary and Indranil Rajguru as the National Joint Secretary.

299.title: Demolition of 'illegally constructed' house of Prayagraj violence accused underway
299.article_body: Demolition of the "illegally constructed" residence of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed is underway. The move came after Prayagraj Development Authority (PDA) earlier put a demolition notice at the residence. News agency ANI reported that heavy security force has been deployed in front of Ahmed's residence. The PDA had asked him to vacate the house by 11 am today.

300.title: That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun Shanaka: Aaron Finch
300.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs in the third T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch praised Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka's knock. "That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun tonight...I don't think our choice of batting first today had any reason for the defeat," he stated. Dasun smashed 25-ball 54 runs in the match.

301.title: Ready to play for Eng Test side if McCullum wants me in it: Moeen Ali
301.article_body: English all-rounder Moeen Ali has opened up to the idea of coming out of retirement from Test cricket and represent the English Test side. "When, or if, (England head coach) Brendon McCullum wants me, I'll play in Pakistan. I have played Pakistan Super League out there a few years ago," Ali said. Notably, England will tour Pakistan in November-December 2022.

302.title: UP groom leaves mandap for drinking water, runs from wedding over no dowry
302.article_body: A groom who was getting married among 144 couples in a mass-wedding event ran away from the wedding after he did not get dowry he wanted, reports said. Reports added that the groom had left the 'mandap' on pretext of going to drink water. When he did not return, massive search was reportedly initiated but he could not be traced.

303.title: Stop wearing 'I work long hrs, have no time for family' as a badge of honour: Namita
303.article_body: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director and Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar took to Twitter to talk about work-life balance. She wrote, "Stop wearing 'I work long hours, I travel a lot, I have no time for family' as a badge of honour. Let's fix work-life balance at all companies so we have a mentally fit and more productive generation next."

304.title: Hardik extremely versatile, you can play him at no. 4 and no. 6 as well: Bangar
304.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has called all-rounder Hardik Pandya an "extremely versatile" player, who can be used in multiple roles by the team. "Hardik has worked very well on his game's foundation. You can play him at number four and at number six as well," Bangar added. Hardik scored 31*(12) in the first T20I against South Africa.

305.title: Woman attacked with blade for resisting eve-teasing in Bhopal, gets 118 stitches on face
305.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men and slapping one of them in Bhopal which led to 118 stitches on her face. The woman's one eye is not opening and she's not even able to speak, police said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said stringent action will be taken against the accused.

306.title: Rebranded McDonald's outlets open in Russia, renamed 'Vkusno & tochka'
306.article_body: The first 15 rebranded restaurants of former McDonald's reopened in Russia on Sunday under the name 'Vkusno & tochka', which means "Tasty & that's it". The new owner had recently unveiled their logo which featured two french fries and a burger. In May, McDonald's shut its business in Russia after 30 years of operation over the Ukraine war.

307.title: B'luru records 87% rise in new COVID-19 cases in 7 days with 545 cases
307.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by about 87% in the last seven days as 545 new cases were reported on Saturday, according to BBMP data. The city had recorded 291 new cases on June 5. Only one COVID-19 death was recorded during the period and the total active clusters remained above 10, the data showed.

308.title: 'More transmissible' Omicron BA.4 COVID-19 variant detected in Russia
308.article_body: The Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 has been detected in Russia, the country's health watchdog Rospotrebnadzor's genome lab head Kamil Khafizov said. "A number of studies published recently have revealed that variants...BA.4 and BA.5 are a little bit more transmissible than...early forms of Omicron," he said. Currently, BA.2 variant and its sub-variant are dominant in the country, he added.

309.title: Don't want to close door to China, willing to engage: Taiwan
309.article_body: Taiwan Premier Su Tseng-chang has said the country has always had goodwill towards China. "As long as there is equality, reciprocity and no political preconditions, we are willing to engage in goodwill with China," he said. "Taiwan does not want to close the door to China," he added. He blamed China for using "means to oppress and treat Taiwan unreasonably".

310.title: Prominent leader of Shiv Sena to attend Oppn leaders’ meeting: Raut
310.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said a prominent leader of the party will take part in Opposition leaders’ meeting called by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on June 15, instead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. The decision comes as the CM will be in Ayodhya at that time, Raut stated. The meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential poll.

311.title: One of the best T20I finishes, that was brutal hitting by Shanaka: Malinga
311.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga has praised Dasun Shanaka for his unbeaten 54-run innings against Australia in their third T20I in Pallekele. "One of the best T20I finishes I've ever witnessed. That was some brutal hitting [by Shanaka]," tweeted Malinga. Shanaka's knock helped Sri Lanka to chase down 59 runs in the last three overs and win by four wickets.

312.title: Cong, JD(S) have accepted BJP as 'A' team: Karnataka CM
312.article_body: After BJP won three out of four Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka on Friday, CM Basavaraj Bommai has spoken about the opposition parties namely JD(S) and Congress. "We are not bothered as to who is the 'B' team...It means both the opposition parties have accepted that BJP is the 'A' team," CM Bommai said.

313.title: Won't outstay my welcome as England manager: Gareth Southgate
313.article_body: England head coach Gareth Southgate has said that he will not outstay his welcome as the football team's manager. "I think I can do a good job for the team, and...we have done a good job for the team," he stated. Southgate signed a contract extension in November last year and will remain England manager till 2024 end.

314.title: Power supply gets disrupted in Nepal after man climbs onto transmission line
314.article_body: Electricity production in Nepal's Nuwakot's hydro-electric plant was disrupted after a person climbed onto a power transmission line and has been clinging to it. The state electricity authority, Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) was forced to shut down the power project. As per an NEA official, an average loss of around one million Nepalese Rupees has been incurred due to this.

315.title: Death knell for rule of law: Karti after buildings bulldozed in UP
315.article_body: After buildings of those accused of violence during protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur, Congress’ Karti Chidambaram said state-sponsored vigilante justice is the "death knell" for the rule of law. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished.

316.title: I would want South Africa to drop David Miller, jokes Bhuvneshwar Kumar ahead of 2nd T20I
316.article_body: Ahead of the second India-South Africa T20I, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "It is difficult bowling to David Miller." He added, "He is in such good form. I would want South Africa to drop him but they would not do so." Bhuvneshwar stated, "He batted so well in the IPL, we know his calibre. Bowling to him would be a challenge."

317.title: Salman joins Kamal, Chiranjeevi at Vikram success party, pics surface
317.article_body: Pictures of actor Salman Khan with actors Kamal Haasan and Chiranjeevi at the success party of the film 'Vikram' have surfaced on social media. Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and shared the pictures and wrote, "Absolute joy, celebrating and honouring my dearest old friend Kamal for the spectacular success of 'Vikram' along with my dearest Sallu Bhai."

318.title: R Madhavan’s Rocketry trailer launched at Times Square, actor shares video
318.article_body: The trailer of actor R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' was screened at the NASDAQ Billboard at Times Square in New York. The actor took to Instagram and shared a video of the crowd at Times Square. The film is written, produced and directed by Madhavan, who also plays the lead role.

319.title: Trent Boult equals world record for scoring most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket
319.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult equalled the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 16*(18), Boult took his tally of Test runs at number 11 to 623. He equalled former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan's record. Boult scored 623 runs in 78 innings, while Muralitharan scored in 98 innings.

320.title: 19 lakh+ devotees undertook Char Dham Yatra since May 3: Temple Committee
320.article_body: The Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee said that since the Char Dham Yatra began on May 3, over 19 lakh devotees have undertaken the journey. Reports said that 6,57,547 pilgrims reached Badrinath Dham From May 8 to June 11 evening, while 6,33,548 pilgrims have reached the Kedarnath Dham from May 6 to June 11 evening.

321.title: India hands over 50-bed hospital in Bokhtar to Tajikistan
321.article_body: India's Ambassador to Tajikistan Viraj Singh on Saturday handed over the 50-bed India-Tajikistan Friendship Hospital (ITFH) in Bokhtar to the Tajik Deputy Defence Minister Major General Shohiyon Abdusottor. The medical equipment, medicines, stores and support equipment were also handed over, a press release said. The ITFH, which was renovated by the Indian government, was inaugurated in 2014.

322.title: Thousands stage protests against gun violence across US
322.article_body: Tens of thousands of people took out rallies across the US demanding a law to curb gun violence in the country. This comes in the wake of a spate of mass shootings across the country including the Texas school shooting incident. A group called March For Our Lives (MFOL) estimated that about 40,000 people assembled in the capital Washington DC.

323.title: Ukraine in control of Luhansk plant sheltering hundreds, claims Guv
323.article_body: Ukraine is in control of a chemical plant in Luhansk's Sievierodonetsk where hundreds of people are sheltering, the region's Governor Serhiy Gaidai claimed. As per Ukraine authorities, about 800 people are hiding there. Moreover, Gaidai said that information about a blockade at the plant is a "lie" after a Russian-backed Luhansk official stated that 300-400 Ukrainian troops were blockaded there.

324.title: AIMIM will contest this year's Gujarat Assembly elections: Owaisi
324.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi announced at a press conference on Saturday that his party will contest in the Gujarat Assembly elections scheduled to be held later this year. "We will fight Gujarat Assembly elections with full strength. However, we haven't decided on how many seats. I believe that Sabir Kabliwala (AIMIM Gujarat chief) will make the right decision," Owaisi said.

325.title: In a world first, Canada proposes to print health warnings on every cigarette
325.article_body: Canada is poised to become the first country in the world to require health warnings to be printed on individual cigarettes. Mental Health and Addictions Minister said the current proposal is "Poison in every puff". The new packaging would help to ensure health-related messages reach people who often access cigarettes one at a time in social situations, the government said.

326.title: Hand grenade found near Delhi-Noida Direct flyway, area cordoned off
326.article_body: A hand grenade was reportedly found near the Delhi-Noida Direct flyway on Saturday. Reports said that youths bathing in the Yamuna informed police about a sack with hand grenade. The whole area was reportedly cordoned off to avoid any untoward incident. "There are a few shops of scrap dealers in the adjoining areas. We are questioning them," an official said.

327.title: Good that people who misuse freedom of speech are sent to jail: Shekhar
327.article_body: Shekhar Suman has said, "People who misuse freedom of speech, it is good that they are sent to jail." He added that people cracking jokes on religion can't get away by saying that it is their freedom of speech. "Freedom comes with responsibility and if you can't take that responsibility then you will have to go to jail," he added.

328.title: Idea is to return to top-level tennis in 2023: Roger Federer
328.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has said that he is "definitely" planning to return to top-level tennis in 2023. "How and where, I don't know yet. But that would be the idea (to return next year)," Federer told a newspaper. He added, "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved...Now Rafa won the French Open 14 times. That's unbelievable."

329.title: This was small battle, big one still left: Fadnavis on RS poll results
329.article_body: After BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said this was a small battle, the big one is still left. "We didn’t get afraid even when state government lodged cases against those who supported us," Fadnavis added. "We're very happy that all our three candidates…have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he stated.

330.title: Double-hundred doesn't mean a hell of a lot: Daryl Mitchell on getting out on 190
330.article_body: New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell has said he doesn't regret getting dismissed for 190(318) during their first innings in the second England Test. "A double-hundred personally doesn't mean a hell of a lot...was just nice to contribute to a score that can help us win," he stated. Mitchell and Tom Blundell added 236 runs to help New Zealand post 553 runs.

331.title: Global star rising, you'll have to learn how to spell his name: Mahindra on Praggnanandhaa
331.article_body: After India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa won the Norway Chess Group A open chess tournament, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "A global star is rising." He added, "You’ll have to learn how to spell his name correctly from now on." Notably, Praggnanandhaa has defeated world champion Magnus Carlsen twice this year.

332.title: In its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also love story: Ayan Mukerji
332.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said a love story is there to talk about in his film 'Brahmastra'. "The thing about 'Brahmastra' is that you won't realise right away but I hope you'll take away is...in its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also a love story amongst being...other things," he stated. "That's a very natural...nice fit with Ranbir Kapoor...Alia Bhatt," he added.

333.title: 4 arrested by Faridabad Police for assaulting, robbing commuters
333.article_body: Four members of a gang were arrested by the Faridabad Police for allegedly abducting, assaulting and robbing commuters in the city. The accused were arrested from Faridabad's Patel Chowk with the help of a tip-off. The accused had already robbed several commuters of ₹10 lakh, police said. The accused were identified as Vikas Kumar, Gajraj, Vishal and Vicky.

334.title: Apple to shift some iPad production units from China to Vietnam amid COVID-19 norms
334.article_body: After facing supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions, Apple is moving some iPad production units from China to Vietnam. To protect itself from future shortages and supply issues, Apple has reportedly asked multiple component suppliers to build up their inventories. Plans of shifting units to Vietnam were earlier delayed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases in Vietnam.

335.title: BCCI will get paid at least ₹93 crore per IPL match from media rights: Jay Shah
335.article_body: Talking about the e-auction of media rights for IPL for 2023-2027 cycle, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said, "Going by the present minimum base price that we have set, BCCI will get paid $12 million (nearly ₹93 crore) per IPL match." He added, "That’s a giant leap for Indian cricket on the world stage. We will be just behind NFL."

336.title: It doesn't bother me, I know my truth: Jennifer on link-up rumours with Tanuj
336.article_body: While talking about link-up rumours with her 'Code M' co-star Tanuj Virwani, actress Jennifer Winget said that it does not bother her. "As long as I know my truth, my family knows the truth, my friends and fans know my truth, that's all that matters to me," she added. Winget had earlier spoken about her separation with actor Karan Grover.

337.title: No change in XI required unless wicket is dry: Gambhir on India-SA 2nd T20I
337.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said no change is required in India's playing XI for the second T20I against South Africa unless the wicket is "extremely dry". Gambhir added, "[If the wicket is dry]...you can sit out a seamer and play the leg-spinner in Bishnoi and Hardik can be your third seamer." India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

338.title: UP CM seems to be presiding over kangaroo court: Mehbooba Mufti
338.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said UP CM Yogi Adityanath seems to be presiding over a "kangaroo court" where minorities are bulldozed on a regular basis. Her statement came after buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur. "Unfortunately, judiciary watches in silence as homes and lives are wrecked," Mufti tweeted.

339.title: 2 more terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba killed in J&K's Pulwama
339.article_body: Two more terrorists were killed in a counter-terrorism operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama, the police said on Sunday. This comes a day after one terrorist was killed there when the encounter broke out. All the three terrorists are linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba and one of them was involved in the killing of a police officer last month, the police added.

340.title: Hyd's theft racket busted, 53 2-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 recovered; 3 held
340.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday arrested three people for being involved in a theft racket. Police recovered 53 two-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 from them. Reports said that the accused stole parked vehicles in the city during the wee hours and sold them in rural areas at lower prices. The accused reportedly told buyers they would receive legal documents of vehicles at earliest.

341.title: Sri Lanka open to buying oil from Russia, says PM Wickremesinghe
341.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said that he is open to buying oil from Russia. He said that the country desperately needs fuel and is currently trying to get oil and coal from suppliers in the Middle East. But if the requirement isn't fulfilled, the country may have to go to Russia again, he added.

342.title: Kerala gold smuggling accused collapses before media, says 'Kill me so story is over'
342.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, collapsed while speaking to the media on Saturday, saying, "Hurt me, please kill me so that the story will get over." This comes after police registered a case against her lawyer over a Facebook post that allegedly hurt religious sentiments. Earlier, she alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan's involvement in the case.

343.title: Hardik Pandya is going to be the game-changer for India: Gavaskar
343.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Hardik Pandya will be a game-changer for Team India, in not just the T20 World Cup, but in every T20I match India play. Gavaskar added that the all-round package in Hardik gives Team India options in selection. "Having him as a full-blown all-rounder is a key to the balance of India's team," Gavaskar stated.

344.title: Pune police bust prostitution racket run from spa; 4 girls rescued
344.article_body: Six people were arrested and four girls were rescued after police busted a prostitution racket following a raid at a spa in Pune's Koregaon Park. The spa allegedly ran the prostitution racket by charging customers more money for "extra services", according to the police. The raid was conducted on June 9, based on a tip-off received by the police.

345.title: 7 bodies found after helicopter crashes in Italy
345.article_body: The bodies of seven people were found two days after the helicopter they flew in crashed in Italy. The deceased included four Turkish, two Lebanese nationals and an Italian pilot. The helicopter took off from Lucca in Tuscany on Thursday and was headed to Treviso city. It reportedly got caught up in a storm and disappeared from the radar screens.

346.title: SL break world record against Australia, chase down most runs in final 3 overs of a T20
346.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Australia by four wickets after chasing down 177-run target in third T20I in Pallekele. During their chase, Sri Lanka broke the world record for successfully chasing down most runs in final three overs of a T20. Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs, breaking Sydney Sixers' record of 56 runs against Sydney Thunder.

347.title: Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal' has larger-than-life visuals: Producer
347.article_body: Producer Murad Khetani, speaking about Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal', has said, "It's a challenging film." However, added that they have a "great team". "Sandeep Reddy Vanga (director) has written the story...he narrated it to Ranbir and Anil Kapoor, they liked it and agreed to come on board," he added. He added the film has action, emotion, heroism and "larger-than-life visuals".

348.title: IAS officer shares Class 10 marksheet of DM in Gujarat, says 'Got only passing marks'
348.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Saran took to Twitter to share Class 10 marksheet of Collector and DM of Gujarat's Bharuch district, saying "He got only passing marks in Class 10." Saran added, "He got 35 marks in English, 36 in Mathematics and 38 in Science...Not only in whole village but in his school it was said that he cannot do anything."

349.title: 318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think bowling first vs NZ wasn't right: Vaughan
349.article_body: Criticising England's fast bowling coach Jon Lewis for saying they took the right call in bowling first against New Zealand in the ongoing second Test, Vaughan tweeted, "318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think that's possibly correct." NZ had ended Day 1 at 318/4 before bundling out for 553 in their first innings. "We took the aggressive option," Lewis had said.

350.title: Delhi Police arrest 2 people in connection with Friday's Jama Masjid protest
350.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested two people under section 153A of IPC in connection with the protest that was held at Jama Masjid on Friday over remarks on Prophet made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and expelled leader Naveen Jindal. "The way people came after offering namaz...with banners and placards...denotes that...there is some kind of planning behind it," police said.

351.title: Assam-based news channel's YouTube account hacked; Pak flag broadcast
351.article_body: Assam-based digital news channel 'TIME8' has said in a press release on Saturday that its YouTube account was hacked by a Pakistan-based group called 'Revolution PK' during a live stream. During the live stream, the Pakistan flag was broadcast along with 'Respect Holy Prophet (PBUH)' tickers, the press release stated. Reportedly, a hymn was also run in the background.

352.title: Starbucks CEO urges staff to return to office, says 'I'll get on my knees'
