352.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz at an event said that his employees are not coming back to the office "at the level" he wants. Schultz said, "I have been unsuccessful, despite everything I've tried to do, to get our people back to work…I've pleaded with them. I said I'll get on my knees. I'll do push-ups. Whatever you want. Come back."

353.title: RBL Bank appoints R Subramaniakumar as its new MD & CEO
353.article_body: RBL Bank has appointed R Subramaniakumar as its new MD and CEO for a period of three years. This comes nearly six months after RBL Bank's MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down. Subramaniakumar began his banking career with the state-run Punjab National Bank in 1980 and has previously served as administrator of Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited (DHFL).

354.title: Kerala CM should resign, face probe: Muraleedharan on gold smuggling case
354.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan said Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan should resign and face the investigation, "if he has some morality left". His statement came following the allegation of CM's involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case. "For the first time in history of this country, the CM has been accused of such a serious allegation of smuggling (gold)," Muraleedharan added.

355.title: Protest in Telangana's Adilabad over social media post, police use lathicharge
355.article_body: A protest reportedly erupted over a social media post in Telangana's Adilabad district. Police said that the accused, whose post triggered the protest, has been arrested. "We've registered a case under relevant sections of the IPC (Indian Penal Code) against one person...for hurting religious sentiments," police added. Reports said that police dispersed the crowd with use of batons.

356.title: BJP ready to use bulldozer model against those disturbing peace in K’taka: CT Ravi
356.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that the party is prepared to replicate the "bulldozer model" of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath against those who disturb communal harmony and peace in Karnataka. Furthermore, he said that a few political parties that have lost polls are trying to stir up unrest in the country.

357.title: 2 ragpickers die after entering into sewer in Delhi
357.article_body: Two ragpickers died after they entered a sewage tank in Delhi on Saturday, said police. The victims - 21-year-old Abdul Rehman and 22-year-old Ramzan - had entered the sewer to collect plastic waste. When the two did not come out, a third ragpicker entered the sewer. The two were then dragged out and were found in an unconscious state.

358.title: Rape lawsuit seeking ₹195 crore from Cristiano Ronaldo dismissed by US judge
358.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a 2018 Nevada lawsuit accusing Cristiano Ronaldo of rape in 2009 and requesting the Portuguese footballer pay the alleged victim more than ₹195 crore in damages. The judge said that the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith" through repeated use of stolen, privileged documents to prosecute the case.

359.title: India sees over 8,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd day, active cases rise to 44,513
359.article_body: India has reported 8,582 COVID-19 cases, 4,435 recoveries, and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,329 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 44,513, while the death toll reached 5,24,761.

360.title: First Russian passports handed out to Ukrainians in occupied Kherson: Report
360.article_body: The Russian authorities have reportedly started handing out Russian passports to the Ukrainians living in the occupied city of Kherson for the first time. According to one of Russia's news agencies, 23 Kherson residents received Russian passports at a ceremony on Saturday. Kherson was one of the first cities that Russia conquered in the initial days of the war.

361.title: Man kills estranged wife's live-in partner in Delhi; arrested
361.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Robin, was arrested after he stabbed his estranged wife's live-in partner to death in Delhi, said police. The woman told the police that she was having a marital dispute and had been living with Kunal, the victim, for the last six months. She was going home with Kunal when Robin stabbed him several times, said police.

362.title: Ratan Tata receives honorary doctorate from Maharashtra's HSNC University
362.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the Honorary Doctorate of Literature by Maharashtra's HSNC University, as a mark of appreciation for his contribution to society. The Governor of Maharashtra and the Chancellor of the university Bhagat Singh Koshyari presented the degree to Tata. "This means so much to me," said Tata during his acceptance speech.

363.title: 2 arrested for snatching gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers
363.article_body: Two snatchers, who were part of a six-member gang that allegedly snatched gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers, were arrested on Friday. The police recovered over 10 gold chains and two motorcycles from the accused's possession. Notably, the gang has over 100 cases registered against them in several areas including the Golf Course Road, Nirvana and Malibu Towne, police said.

364.title: Akshay sir said he's worked with most newcomers, I think I'm the 22nd: Manushi
364.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said that actor Akshay Kumar told her he has worked with most newcomers in the industry. "So I think I'm the 22nd newcomer that Akshay sir has worked with," she said, adding, "For me, I couldn't have asked for a better launch because somewhere I knew that they [Akshay Kumar and Dr Chadraprakash Dwivedi] were so experienced."

365.title: India needs President who can protect Constitution: Congress
365.article_body: The Congress party is of the opinion that India needs a person as President who can protect the Constitution, our institutions and citizenry from the ongoing "onslaught" by the ruling party, Congress said. The statement comes as West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called a meeting of the Opposition leaders, ahead of the election for the next President of India.

366.title: Pune Metro's revenue dips after 3 months as ridership falls
366.article_body: Pune Metro's revenue saw a decline in May as compared to March when the two lines - Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi and Vanaz to Garware College - had started. While the revenue in March was ₹76,43,500, it was only ₹27,97,146 in May. The ridership number had surged massively after its launch on March 6, said an official.

367.title: B'luru's Singanayakanahalli lake project 'stalled' after criticism: Report
367.article_body: The forest department and the minor irrigation department have apparently stopped pursuing the development project of Bengaluru's Singanayakanahalli lake, The Indian Express reported. Last year, the authorities proposed to axe around 6,316 trees for the project. A senior forest official told The Indian Express, "There was a huge public outcry over axing trees. The project has stalled as of now."

368.title: Ex-Punjab MLA suffers ₹10 lakh loss as robbers steal 10 buffaloes from farm
368.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Tarsem Jodhan said that he has suffered a loss of ₹10 lakh as robbers stole 10 buffaloes from his farm. "They held my workers captive, while they loaded the stolen buffaloes in a vehicle," Jodhan said. A case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code has been registered against the accused, police said.

369.title: Pant is a young captain, he'll improve as series progresses: Bhuvneshwar
369.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's captaincy after India's defeat in the first T20I against South Africa, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "The captain is as good as the team and it's a team effort." He added, "Pant is a young captain and it was his first match. I'm sure he will try to do better and improve as the series progresses."

370.title: B'luru's Idgah Maidan should be preserved as public property: Hindu activist
370.article_body: Hindu activists have reportedly objected to Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan "being treated as property of minorities". Reports said Hindu organisations have decided to celebrate Yoga Day and Independence Day on site. "We will demand from CM Bommai...Idgah Maidan should be preserved as....public property and cultural activities of all religions must be permitted," Hindu activist, Pathapat Srinivas, said.

371.title: Wasn't what my role was supposed to be: Shilpa Shetty on 'Hungama 2'
371.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty said 'Hungama 2' wasn't supposed to be her comeback film. "I said yes to it because I can never say no to Ratan Jain (producer). He introduced...me in the industry," she stated. She added she always wanted to work with filmmaker Priyadarshan. "I saw the film and...felt...this wasn't what my role was supposed to be," she stated.

372.title: Bodies of 2 missing youths found in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake
372.article_body: The bodies of two missing youths, both aged 20, were recovered after villagers found them floating in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake, police officials said. "The youths were missing from June 6 and were found dead on Friday," investigators said. The deceased's families were called after the bodies were identified, following which the bodies were taken for post-mortem, according to police.

373.title: After 5 deaths, officials say K'taka filtration unit not cleaned for 5 yrs
373.article_body: As five people died after drinking contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur, officials reportedly admitted several wards in city get untreated water. Reports said that officials admitted the filtration unit had not been cleaned or maintained for past five years. Raichur City Municipal Council Commissioner said junior engineer and assistant executive engineer have been suspended in the case.

374.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Gaffar market, 39 fire engines rushed to spot
374.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Gaffar market in Delhi on Sunday. "A serious fire call was received from a shoe market in Gaffar, Karol Bagh, at 4:16 am and 39 fire tenders were rushed to the site," Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said. The fire is under control and no one is trapped or injured, ANI reported.

375.title: Who are the 7 final bidders for ₹60,000-crore IPL broadcast rights?
375.article_body: The e-auction for IPL media rights for the next five-year cycle (2023 to 2027) will take place today. Disney-Star, Sony, Viacom-Reliance, Zee, Fun Asia, Super Sport and Times Internet are in the running. The number of bidders this time is half that of the previous auction. The cost to acquire the rights is estimated to be up to ₹60,000 crore.

376.title: 2 AirAsia Delhi-Srinagar flights face technical issues within hrs of each other
376.article_body: AirAsia India's two aircraft on Delhi to Srinagar route returned to the national capital after facing technical issues mid-air on the same day. While one flight took off from Delhi around 11.55 am, the technical issue was informed to passengers mid-air, half an hour later. The substitute aircraft also developed a similar issue and returned to Delhi around 5.30 pm.

377.title: 1 killed, 2 injured as under-construction building falls in Pune
377.article_body: A labourer was killed and two others were injured after an under-construction building collapsed in Pune's Kiwale village. The deceased labourer has been identified as 26-year-old Sandeep Balsingh from Jharkhand. "The construction workers were working at a site around 30 feet deep inside for a basement construction when a part of huge debris suddenly fell on them," said police.

378.title: I don't think we'll see Umran Malik playing in 2nd T20I vs SA: Jaffer
378.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's unlikely that pacer Umran Malik will make his India debut in the second T20I against South Africa. "It would be unfair to change the team after one game...Since it's a five-game series, there are always chances of getting opportunities later," he stated. India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

379.title: Competed with Salman for 'Maine...', discussions were on to launch me: Deepak
379.article_body: Actor-Director Deepak Tijori said he and actor Salman Khan had auditioned for role of 'Prem' in the movie 'Maine Pyar Kia'. "Salman and I were only...people who were competing for the role of Prem, neck-to-neck...They had even told me that if they selected me...they'd like to change my name on...screen and discussed how they'd like to launch me," Tijori added.

380.title: Shaan said 'Don't come in big cars, come in autos, people will give work': Mika
380.article_body: Singer Mika Singh said that when he was new, singer Shaan had told him to not come in big cars "because one doesn't get work". "[He said] 'You simply come in autos...people will give you work'. I thought I had to change things...That a singer shouldn't only be seen in singing shows but should get opportunities everywhere," Mika added.

381.title: BJP will be in Guinness Book for paper leaks: Kejriwal in Himachal
381.article_body: Addressing a gathering at Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The BJP government will be in the Guinness Book of World Records for paper leaks...during its rule." Kejriwal said, "I don't understand why papers are being leaked in Gujarat, Haryana and Himachal." He added, "Why doesn't it happen in our Delhi?"

382.title: We don't need Nupur Sharma's apology: Owaisi on Prophet remark row
382.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said there is no need to seek an apology from Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad since an FIR has been filed against her. "Law will take its own course," Owaisi said. Criticising Jharkhand's government over violence on Friday, he said, "There was firing on people in Ranchi, this shouldn't have happened."

383.title: Nadda meets envoys of 13 countries as part of 'Know BJP' initiative
383.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda interacted with envoys of 13 countries at the party headquarters in Delhi, where he informed them about the party's ideology, history and ongoing activities. This is the fourth such event held by the BJP President. The interaction was a part of the 'Know BJP' initiative which was launched on BJP's foundation day on April 6.

384.title: Strict action must be taken against hatemongers: Sachin Pilot
384.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said strict action must be taken against those spreading hate in society. Reacting to comments over Prophet Muhammad, he said that the Centre wasn't bothered when people of the country demanded action against the spokesperson but was prompt in doing so when foreign countries issued denunciations. Pilot also criticised the Centre over rising inflation and unemployment.

385.title: 30 Army personnel named in chargesheet filed over death of civilians in Nagaland
385.article_body: Thirty Indian Army personnel have been named in the chargesheet filed in the connection to the botched security operation in Nagaland's Mon that led to the death of 13 civilians in December 2021. The personnel belonging to 21 Para Special Forces didn't follow the SOP and the Rules of Engagement and resorted to "indiscriminate and disproportionate firing", an SIT alleged.

386.title: Depp's fans criticise Amber for flying in private jet after lawyer said she can't pay $10mn
386.article_body: Actress Amber Heard was spotted for the first time since the verdict was announced in Johnny Depp's defamation trial. She was clicked stepping out of a private airplane. "If you can afford that, you can afford to pay what you owe Johnny," a tweet read. Her attorney had said she "absolutely cannot" pay the $10 million she owes Johnny now.

387.title: Sitharaman inaugurates GST museum installed in 400-yr-old building in Goa
387.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday inaugurated 'Dharohar', the National Museum of Customs and GST in Goa. The two-storey building is over 400 years old. It showcases artefacts seized by Indian Customs, including the manuscript of Ain-i-Akbari and replica of Amin pillars. It houses the 'Battle of Wits' gallery, showcasing the cerebral battle between smugglers and Customs officers.

388.title: Past decade saw increase in number of women voters: Book
388.article_body: The number of women voters in India has increased over the past decade, according to a new book released. Till 2010, the number of women voters was less than men, Sanjay Kumar, who edited Women Voters in Indian Elections - Changing Trends and Emerging Patterns, said. In 2019 general election, men and women voted in nearly equal numbers, he added.

389.title: World's smallest singer performs at AR Rahman's daughter's wedding reception
389.article_body: A video has shown music composer AR Rahman listening to the world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik performing 'Papa Kehte Hain' at the former's daughter's wedding reception. The video was shared by the Tajik singer on his Instagram page with the caption "Godfather". The reception for Rahman's daughter Khatija and son-in-law Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed was held in Chennai on Friday.

390.title: Indian startup FarEye fires 250 workers globally ahead of appraisal: Report
390.article_body: Indian logistics startup FarEye has laid off as many as 250 employees globally ahead of their appraisal, as per reports. The startup's Co-Founder and CEO Kushal Nahata cited the "softness in market conditions" as the reason behind this move. In 2021, Nahata said FarEye aimed to become a unicorn in 6-12 months after raising $100 million in series E funding.

391.title: Contain Tamil Nadu's COVID-19 spread: CM MK Stalin tells officials
391.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said measures should be taken to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state and facilities to treat affected patients should be kept ready, in view of rising cases. Stalin, who chaired a meeting to review the COVID-19 situation, advised various departments and local administration to join hands in containing the COVID-19 spread.

392.title: 42-year-old man kills sister over property dispute in Ahmedabad
392.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Madan Singh, allegedly stabbed his younger sister to death over a property dispute in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Police said the incident occurred around 2 am when Madan Singh stabbed his sister and injured his father and nephew when they tried to prevent him. A murder case has been filed against Singh, who is currently absconding.

393.title: 2 terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K's Kulgam, Pulwama
393.article_body: Two terrorists were killed in two separate encounters with security forces in J&K's Kulgam and Pulwama districts on Saturday, police said. Arms and ammunition, including a rifle along with 23 rounds and a hand grenade, were recovered from the encounter site in Kulgam, an official said. The terrorist killed in Kulgam belonged to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit, the official added.

394.title: With 4 games remaining, we've chance to win series vs SA: Bhuvneshwar
394.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said with four matches remaining, his side has a chance to win the five-match series. "We've to bowl better and we need to bat in the same fashion as the previous game," he added. Match will be played in Cuttack on Sunday. India trail South Africa 0-1 in ongoing series.

395.title: Home Minister Shah seeks early probe of rape, sexual assault cases
395.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday sought an early investigation of rape and sexual assault cases against women and children, according to an official. Shah also sought stringent punishment against the offenders in a time-bound manner, the official said. Shah made the comments at the 25th meeting of the Western Zonal Council in Diu.

396.title: 3 killed, 1 injured after being hit by train in UP's Prayagraj
396.article_body: Three persons were killed and another person was injured after being hit by a train at Shankargarh railway station in Prayagraj, an official said. Some passengers got down on the other side of the platform and while returning, they were hit by the Chambal Express, the official said. It is yet to be known why they got off the train.

397.title: Bride's sister killed, 10 injured in firing at UP wedding function
397.article_body: The 35-year-old sister of a bride was killed and 10 persons were injured when gunshots were fired during a quarrel at a wedding function in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Saturday. "An argument broke out between the family members of the bride and some villagers over applying colours," SP Etah said. He added that some suspects have been detained for questioning.

398.title: He might play at Wimbledon: Toni after nephew Nadal's foot treatment
398.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal revealed that his nephew has been feeling "much better" after the foot treatment and wants to train. "And if he has a little chance, he'll play at Wimbledon. He goes on the court on Monday," he added. Days after his record-extending 14th French Open win, Nadal began treatment for his chronic foot problem in Barcelona.

399.title: Hate and unrest not our way, says Rahul Gandhi
399.article_body: A day after the outbreak of violence during protests over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "Hate and unrest isn't our way." "Our country has always set an example of truth, non-violence and brotherhood before the world," he said. "It's the responsibility of all...people...to unite India and maintain mutual goodwill," he added.

400.title: It could be society ending: Bill Gates on another virus with 5% fatality rate
400.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence to COVID-19 but with 5% fatality rate could be "society ending". He said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could've been way more fatal," Gates claimed.

401.title: Indian crypto investors got lucky due to tax announcement in Feb: Zerodha CEO
401.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on Saturday said many Indian cryptocurrency investors "accidentally got lucky" due to announcement of TDS and tax on crypto during the Budget in February. If not for the announcement, "many could've potentially been trapped trying to buy the dip and then averaging down", Kamath said. The government had announced 30% tax on income from digital assets.

402.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh Shivan get notice for violating Tirupati temple rules, apologise
402.article_body: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan, who visited Tirupati temple after their wedding, received notices for wearing footwear inside the temple and doing photoshoots. "In the commotion, we failed to notice we were walking with shoes...We apologise," the couple said. "We've been to Tirupati five times in...last month with the desire to get married...Due to various reasons, it wasn't possible," they added.

403.title: India will definitely bounce back in 2nd T20I: SA all-rounder Parnell
403.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said the side's second T20I against India in Cuttack will be crucial, adding the hosts will definitely bounce back. "They're a quality side; we don't expect anything less...every single game till Bengaluru is going to be tough," he added. South Africa are currently leading 1-0 in five-match series. Second T20I will be played on Sunday.
